content: 'I am impressed by this product. More and more I am seeing other vehicles switch to aftermarket headlights. I decided on going with the LED H4 / 9003 and this seller had a good price. Received them today and was excited to install them. My wife is NOT mechanically inclined so I made her do it. We have a Acura EL which is very similar to a Honda. There are many online videos showing how to replace the H4 bulb with an LED type.'bIt took about 5 mins to replace the passenger side and about half hour to replace drivers side because of the proximity of the power steering system (Acura/Honda's fault). These LED bulbs even have a mini fan system that cools the bulb assembly built right in. The results were noticeable immediately. The light was brighter and well distributed. I had no idea LED was such an upgrade from halogen. We had wet rainy weather here today and we drove around town in the evening. We noticed the light illuminated the area in front of us and the road signs much better than the old bulbs.Quick shipping, easy to install, excellent illumination, good price. I would recommend this product to everyone.'
title: 'LED performed beyond expectations!'

content: 'My daughter is using this night lamp as a bedside table lamp and she likes it.' This lamp has colourful lights which gives a happy feeling; we can choose the light as per our mood and time. On top of this, this lamp is touch control which is pretty easy to operate. Adjustable brightness is another noteworthy feature. We can use it for reading in bright setting and use as a night lamp in dim setting.'In-built rechargeable battery gives us convenience of wireless operation. We can wirelessly place it anywhere. Only one thing, we wish it would come in a bit bigger size. Otherwise it is a nice customizable and affordable night lamp .'
title: 'Colourful and customizable night lamp !!'

content: 'I installed these bulbs on a Freightliner Coronado. I am very happy with the final result. The low beams are very bright but do not blind oncoming drivers. The high beam pattern is not as focused to the front as I would like but does a great job of illuminating the sides of the road. The install took 10 minutes and they were properly aimed right out of the box. I had to cut the rubber boot to fit around the bulb housing and that was about it. I will update this review in the near future as I get some experience with them.'
title: 'A nice bright bul

content: 'I am honestly impressed with this lamp, not only it looks very futuristic and professional but it also packs so many features. First, it has an LCD screen display with the date, temperature and the clock which you can choose a 12 hour or 24 hour format. It also has 3 color modes and 5 brightness levels. Its perfect if you need a desk lamp for late night office work or studying or just reading a book. Its not hard on the eye and its perfect for everyday use. The best thing about this lamp is the fact that you can adjust it on however you wanted. Its very flexible and yet sturdy. The quality is great considering its leade. Would definitely recommend!'

'Ordered this as an alternative to a plastic architect lamp from Walmart. It seemed to be made out of metal and therefore of better quality for just a few dollars extra. Well, it is made out of metal and the base and arm are great. However the lamp\'s head itself feels really cheaply made. When arrived, the bulb was not centered inside the lampshade but luckily the socket is so cheaply mounted that it\'s very easy to bend it back. The light switch on top is easy to turn but the its feel and quality of the plastic just doesn\'t inspire any confidence that it\'ll last. The lampshade is metal but quite thin but wouldn\'t be an issue if it wasn\'t for everything else. It\'s just such a shame given that the base and arm are pretty good.'bSpeaking of the base and arm though, they have their own problem: on architect's lamps usually both the lower and upper arms are free to move, giving it good reach. On this model though, for whatever reason, Globe decided to lock the bottom arm in place, so it will swivel but won't move back and forth. My guess they were worried about the lamp tipping over because the base isn't heavy enough. Unfortunately, this means that the lamp has a poor reach. You can use it on your desk to write in a notebook, but that's pretty much it. My wife wanted to use this lamp over her sewing machine and this lamp just wouldn't reach.Now, there is a screw and a little bolt at the base of the arm that I have removed, at my own risk, to free the lower arm and allow it to swivel as architect lamps should. It is concerning though that the manufacturer has disabled this feature from the factory though.'bAll-in-all, it'll do the job now that the bottom arm is free to move, but it's still just okay - far from great.
title: 'Poor reach and cheap lamp head'

content: 'First of all, how a product that has 181 ratings with a 4 star average is somehow complete garbage.'bThe item itself didn't come in a box or a package it came it the box you would buy off the shelf with a shipping label attached. Completely broken box. It was tapped on one end. I would take a picture but of what? There isn't enough of a box to take a picture of.The product... The product was just as garbage as the box. Everything bent. The globe lamp part was not a globe but just a very squished circle made into a oval ( probably from Shipping ) .. I took it out of what little of the box was left and to my surprise a screw fell out... Where does it attach? Your guess is as good as mine.'bIt's sad that I can't even donate the item or salvage it in any way. It's completely useless.
title: 'Ratings Mean Nothing'

content: 'Build quality and fit and finish are not great. Plastic clampy bits at the neck, plastic on/off knob. What this translates to is a lamp that doesn\'t hold it\'s position. You constantly have to tighten it. Another reviewer already mentioned the fact that the bottom articulation is forced into a fixed position by 2 unnecessary screws. Why? I almost wrecked it trying to bend the lamp. The included base is too small and too light, making the light unsteady. Really, people buying these lamps are not looking for features, they just want basic functionality. I can\'t recommend this one when you can get a better quality lamp at Ikea for half the price.'
title: 'Not a great quality desklamp'

content: 'bIt seems well made, but has one very annoying feature. The bottom hinge (or 'joint') is locked with a bolt, which means only the middle elbow joint can be adjusted (and the top joint where the lamp is attached). This greatly reduces the range of adjustments. The bottom arm is locked in that upright position that you see in the pic. I suppose this is the manufacturer's way of ensuring people don't over extend the distance from the base to the lamp, so it doesn't fall over. But if you want a lamp where you can swing the arm out and adjust it any particular angle, this one won't do it.
title: 'bBottom arm locked in position -- you can't adjust it

content: 'bThis is rated as a one because it is cheaply made. But that's not what bugged me about it. Notice in the picture that the lower arm is set BACK from the vertical. If you move it forward to 90 degrees the lamp will fall over. There is even a bolt to prevent you from doing this. I wanted a light to sit back on my desk and reach over my work. The base is not heavy enough. I figured that it needs two kilos or five more pounds of weight. Took a lot of head scratching to make this work over my hobby desk. I figured a quick easy solution to my problem but if you want this lamp to reach out , say by your bedside forget it.
title: 'Lamp easy to top over !'

content: 'The lamp base is solid and heavy. The springs are dark coloured so they look good. The lamp shade attaches a bit precariously. The design and photos may give the impression that the lamp arm will flex up/down at the lower arm connection to the base. That joint and angle are fixed and the lower two springs are, unfortunately, simply decorative. Hence with the back-angled lower arm (mine appears to be even more angled than the photos), the purported height/length and the potential reach of the lamp is significantly less than it appears. It can still function adequately as a desk light, but if you were counting on an extended reach application, this is not going to perform like a true architect s lamp.'
title: 'Not Quite What It Appears'

content: 'bTall swing arm work lamp. I was really looking forward to using it, but the shipping company used was a nightmare and it got to me damaged. The plastic On/Off switch on top of the lamp fixture itself was broken clean off when I opened the box. Looking at it, it does seems that one spot is THE spot where it could be prone to breakage. Otherwise, design-wise, it's a very study and well built lamp. Came with a pair of spare springs as well. I just wish I could have actually enjoyed using it. Had to return and after two package nightmares with the same shipping company this month I'm afraid to reorder. Returned for refund.
title: 'Looked great but.....'

content: 'I have used many hid kits and tried several expensive halogen upgrade bulb replacements in the past. After installing these LEDs into a 2009 NIssan Rogue the light output is actually quite bright and almost comparable to hid. Its a cleaner white output than HID. Minimal glare output in the rouge housing causing no problems to on coming traffic. Install was extremely easy. Just swab bulbs and plug into oem connector. If they don\'t turn on just flip the connection as the polarity might be reversed. While running the bulbs have a slight quiet hum to them from the cooling fan. But very happy with these, highly recommended and would buy again if needed.'
title: 'A MUST upgrade from halogens and alternative to HID pnp kids'

content: 'I use this only for sleep since the light bulb from my salt lamp has busted and I cannot find the same one anywhere... My sleep setting is on the red light and even after leaving it on the whole night, it doesn\'t overheat which is good. content: 'I made the switch to LED from Halogen. Less drain on my batteries and very bright. These LED were bright white so have to change both bulbs. content: 'This lamp should be a case study in value engineering for designers and engineering students. How much metal can we replace with plastic? How thin can we make the remaining metal? How far can we stretch the term long cord? If you plan to put this lamp in one place and never move it again and never use the swing functions it will serve just fine. I fully expect the plastic joint between the globe and the swing arm to fail after only a few rotations.'bThe lower swing arm is bolted in place so it doesn't swing. Simple enough to remove the pin put in place to prevent movement. Same if you want the arm to rotate, just don't install the thumbscrew. If Globe wants to trim a few more pennies out of the bill of materials and ship a functional architect lamp, they could omit these bolts.This lamp is exactly what I expect a $25 lamp to be.'
title: 'bIt's a $25 lamp; and that is exactly what you get.

content: 'TL;DR Summary:'Pros (+):'+Stylish'+Touch controls'+Dimmable'+Memory feature'+5 lighting modes'Cons (-):'-NONE'Read the full review for more.'================'This product is excellent value for what it really is. It s a sleek looking lamp, that fits in any modern household as a side table lamp or a desk lamp. It s all touch controlled, so there s no knobs or buttons to worry about breaking. It has different colour modes for different shades and settings, and different brightness levels depending on the mood you want to set. The dimmable feature is my favorite! Also did I mention that it s foldable? This makes it easy to transport as well! Overall well designed and well worth it!'======================='Rating Breakdown (5/5)'Product Quality: 5'Ease of use: 5'Performance: 5'Value for Money: 5'Overall: 5'
title: 'Stylish and modern'

content: 'I detest overhead lights and much prefer desk lamps. I spend a lot of time on my computer and need to have a lamp nearby as I often am referring to paperwork. I was in the market for a new lamp and the TaoTronics Portable Desk Lamp looked like what I was after. And it was!'The item is indeed lightweight weighing in at 1.3 pounds, comes with a USB cord AND a wall plug adapter. (Although the instruction book lists a cleaning cloth in the contents, I did not receive one.)'The best feature by far is that you can plug it directly into a USB slot on your computer. The lamp head is adjustable a full 180 degrees. And the lamp arm is also adjustable for 90 degrees. (Note there is no side to side adjustment.) The light is LED. And according to the manufacturer will last up to'50, 000 hours under normal use. The interface for controlling is a simple touch pad on the clearly marked buttons on the base. They are responsive to a very light touch. (These are flush with the base, so if you\'re in the dark you\'ll have to feel around) On/off. A plus and a minus button let you cycle through the five brightness settings. There are three settings for the light quality itself. Here\'s another plus - your current settings will be remembered when you next turn the light on.'bI'm quite happy with this light - the number of adjustments available to the user from light strength and tone, to the numerous head and arm settings. It's perfect for my home office and just what I needed.bAs of the writing of this review there is no price listed, so I can't comment on value for dollar.
title: 'Perfect for my home office'

content: 'This is a nice little desk/task lamp that provides a decent amount of light. I like that it is possible to select from five different levels of brightness and from three different light colours (3000K, 4500K, 6000K). The light can be folded up very small, which makes it an excellent choice to take with you on trips to light up those far to dark hotel rooms.'bThe light comes with a power cord. Unfortunately, the cord sticks out from the back of the lamp a fair bit, so it can't be pushed snug up against the wall. You can power the lamp with the included power plug or you can power it with a USB cable and any portable power pack or computer USB port. Very handy!The lamp has a large base and is articulated at two points. It is possible to adjust it a fair bit, but I found it hard to get it to exactly the right angle for some tasks just by virtue of how the joints of the lamp work.'bI've found the light to be nice and bright on the top three settings, and suitably dimmer on the lower settings for nighttime use.Overall, this is a nice little desk lamp with easy to use controls and a modern, sleek look.'
title: 'Handy desk lamp that runs via USB or power cord'

content: 'bThis light is decievingly powerful! Its light and small but don't be fooled! It is ver bright and extremely easy to use! One touch and hold for the base night light, and one quick simple touch to turn light on low, med, or high. In the pic I have it on low. Top light is white cool light, bottom is warm. Not a big deal to me as I have plently of extras laying around the house.This was purchased as a gift for my dad as a reading lamp. It is very convenient for him that it is touch, lightweight and minimizes space use as he has limited room on his coffee table. Very pleased with this little lamp jam packed with light!'

content: 'Got 3 as reading lights for my kids. They love them. They charge easily, and so far the charge holds 3+ days of 1-2 hours of use each day.'bOnly thing I didn't like was the proprietary cord end. I like universal cords like mini USB, so they are replaceable. but with 3 lamps in the house, if we break 1 cord, we can borrow from another.
title: 'Good for my kids'

content: 'bThis was exactly what I needed on my bedside table to read at night. Its easy to set up (just plug it in), turn it on at the back, and you set how bright you want the lamp to be by touching the square at the top-front of the base. I was surprised when I removed the wire and the lamp was still on because I didn't know it was a portable lamp.It also acts as a dim night light if the base has that light on with the main LED lamp turned off. Overall it was a definitely worth the purchase!'
title: 'Lightweight, portable, and bright!'

content: 'bThe arm is locked in position by two screws even though this style is designed to articulate into a forward position. When I removed them the lamp base doesn't have enough weight to hold up the arm. It balances precariously when I angle it forward slightly. The base needs more weight. I can't recommend this lamp
title: 'bI can't recommend this

content: 'Very pleased with this. I have a small bedside table and needed a lamp that wouldn t take up too much space, and this does the trick perfectly! The on/off switch might not be everyone s preference, but I ve just set it on the edge of the table and it s been working great for me.'
title: 'Great for a small lamp'

content: 'bI bought this lamp on a whim because I needed a basic white lamp for my son's room. I didn't look at all the pictures or read the description (my mistake) but this is a MINI lamp, not full size! It can't even fit a normal sized light bulb. It's also made of very poor quality materials. For $15, it's not worth it at all in my opinion (especially when you can buy a full-size lamp for a couple of dollars more). I also think it's kind of a red flag that they do not obviously mark this as a mini lamp. It's not in the title or the first picture, you have to look through the pictures or read the description to figure it out so I'm guessing they were hoping people would mistakingly buy it as I did. Either way, I now own a lamp that's about the size of a 500 ml water bottle, I have to specialty light bulbs for and was so flimsy that the stand bent in shipping. Yay me.
title: 'Read the Dimensions!'

content: 'bThis is a really pretty lamp that gives a nice ambiance. I thought from the pic that the swirls were a cream / tan color but as it turns out the frame of the lamp is a very bright white. Not quite what I was expecting. Nothing a little dry brushing wont fix but they should show a pic when it's not on.b (I guess it does say that it's white in the description but I was still expecting a soft off white not a crisp bright white) Otherwise it's pretty bright, has an on off switch on the chord and is a very warm light when on. I really like it.. I'll just have to fix the color.

The on/off is controlled on the light fixture itself, like a normal lamp. I hooked up a Philips bluetooth LED Edison bulb that I can turn on/off and adjust the brightness level from my phone.

content: 'Nice set of 2 little lamps. They are touch lamps with 3 brightness settings. Not very sturdy, very light weight. They take up to a 40W bulb. The base is a dark rose gold colour (not wood as some of the pictures in the ad make it seem). Wouldn t recommend for a kids room at all. Overall I m happy with it but the quality is maybe one step above the dollar store, so a little pricey ($30/pair) for what it is.'

No time to return these due to the scratches, but disappointed as they are not that cheap!'
title: 'Arrived scratched'

content: 'bThis is a lovely little lamp that perfectly fits our needs. We used LED light bulbs and the dimming effect still works. It might be not as bright for some people's requirements (ie for reading a book), but for me I mostly wanted it as a dim background light in the bedroom for using phones or tablets & it works perfectly for that. I don't know if it's brighter when you're using non-LED bulbs. It doesn't come with the bulbs so you'll have to get that separately.
title: 'Works as expected'

content: 'The lamp are perfect. Not too big. Not too small. Small nighttime side lamp with 3 touch settings depending on your mood. The bightest is enough to light up a medium sized room entirely. The lowest is good for book readers like me who doesnt want to get up and turn the light off after reading.'I LOVE IT.'~ i added a personal touch to mine by doodling on the lamp. The plainwhite wasnt that esthetically please in my room. It has a modern feel which is good in certain places like bureaus but for my bedroom i decided to up it up :D'

content: 'bThe lamp works as advertised, it offers several bight colours that can be switched with just the touch of the lamp's top.- It comes with a USB charging cable which can be plugged in to any 5 volt charger or computer for fast charging.'b- The lamps hold up well with a full charge, I haven't ran out yet after the first full charge and i've been using it for approximately 20mins each night for the past 3 weeks.- The lamp also comes with a carrying handle on the bottom which will definitely come in handy for camping and moving around during power outages.'Overall neat little lamp, great for camping, as a night table lamp, great for reading.'- Pricing is fair, I say this because it is just a lamp - there are other options out there for similar lamps that has bluetooth capability and comes with a built in speaker and voice command. Check your options.'But for the guy that just wants a simple lamp without all the bells and whistles I strongly recommend this one based on battery life and function. 5 stars.'iNiko'

content: 'bOriginally was concerned with the small dimensions of this product, but it fits very well as a small lamp on a bedside table. The three levels of brightness are excellent, the lowest good for getting ready for sleep and the highest more than enough for reading. My only negative comment is that you can't turn the light off without cycling through all three levels of brightness. So when you're ready to sleep you have to flash through the brighter levels. Recommend buying the required light bulbs with it online, had a really hard time finding them in store.
title: 'Surprisingly satisfied'

content: 'bI ordered these for two bed night tables. They work great; have had them for several months now. They give off the right amount of light, not to bright right before bed or first thing in the morning but enough to see what you're doing and read too. Easy touch to turn it on with 3 brightness settings. The only thing to be aware of is the special bulbs which cost more than normal bulbs...I purchased the light bulbs at Home Depot.
title: 'Gives off the right about of light.'

content: 'bWe needed new lamps for our bedside tables and picked these. When they arrived, I realized they were smaller than I'd expected, but ridiculously cute. I loved them. Unfortunately, one of the lamps in the set didn't work, so I contacted their customer service department through their website. They were quick in response and sent me a replacement right away. content: 'Overall, the desk lamp is cost effective! It is powered by a USB cable so it is convenient and suitable for a number of different environmental settings (from living rooms, offices to bedrooms). There are 3 levels of brightness (dark, mid, and bright) and 3 lightening modes (yellow, white, and yellow+white) so the combination of them is quite flexible and versatile. The desk lamp is not very large in volume so it occupies only a small fraction of space on the desk. Based on LED, it is far more energy efficient than traditional bulbs and will never be overheating. I am so satisfied with it!'
title: 'A cost-effective option'

content: 'The product is stopped working after 8 months.'An Update:'Regarding my review for TOPELEK Led Desk Lamp, that I was unhappy with, I was pleasantly surprised that the manufacturer quickly and graciously offered to replace it with the same lamp. Its several setting provide the perfect mood for numerous uses - reading, ambiance, studying! I now think this would make an excellent gift. content: 'UPDATE'Soon after I write this complaining review, their customer service contacted me and sent me a replacement which is of very good quality. The lamp worked well in the first month. However, the power cord is not in good contact, resulting in the light flashing frequently. content: 'These lamps are better-looking than I expected. The base with two different finishes is very stylish. The lampshade screws on to the base with a ring, it doesn\'t have a compression fit on the bulb like older style lampshades. I used an LED bulb in the same size and shape as a regular Edison type bulb because I thought the shade would have to clamp on the bulb. As a result, the bulb is slightly visible over the top of the shade. Next bulb will be a shorter LED since there is no need to clamp onto the bulb. These are small lamps, but look quite nice and the shade diffuses the light nicely. The shades are delicate though, if you squeeze them even slightly there will be a visible mark from the kink and that is permanent.'All in all these are nice looking, functional lamps, good value for the price.'

content: 'I like this lamp. It has a nice weight, plus is built out of solid wood and metal. With an Edison bulb it looks great, and they have two switches, one on the socket, and one on the wire. It seems a bit expensive, for the relatively simple design, especially considering the socket is stamped with CHINA, but it really does look great, and the solid material is a definite bonus.'However, I ordered two of them for for a split display on a shelf. If you have the wire facing the back, you will quickly notice that the socket mounts are aligned differently, so the switches are facing different directions.'bThis may not be a problem for everyone, and is easy to fix, but I personally find it pretty annoying. If it's put where the wire switch is inaccessible, you run the risk of having the bulb switch facing an inaccessible way too.
title: 'bGreat Lamp, but don't buy more than one for the same shelf.

Again my fault, I had seen so many advertised with warm light I assumed it had become standard. So, I wish I had spent an additional $20 to get a lamp with warmer light. content: 'It s a great little lamp, telescopic pole so you can adjust it to your night needs. The led gives off a nice amount of light for reading or crafts. The on/off is a touch feature which was a little tricky at first but it s nice to have too. There is a sticker where you touch so I don t know why I thought it was tricky, probably because I m used to switches and buttons. There is a USB and it s handy when I m in my craft area because I can charge quickly rig he at my finger tips and that s nice too.'The lamp shade is a nice warm color and blends well with any environment and the wood looking base makes it very natural feeling.'The base is heavy enough that it keeps the whole thing sturdy without worry it will fall over when touched. So when my daughter claimed this lamp for her bedroom, beside her bed I thought it was just fine. She needed a new one and she loves it for reading. She says it s a nice warm light and it s easier on her eyes than the hanging lamp she had blaring down on her. So I guess I need a new lamp now for my craft area now and I would buy this one again it s a nice energy saving item.'
title: 'Good for any room that needs a little light.'

content: 'I live in a shared place and was looking for a night lamp that is not irritating to eyes at night.'This design is the perfect choice for my needs. The circular arrangement of LED lights glows the area under the lamp while it avoids spreading light too much at a distance. This lighting in a specific area lets others sleep without any trouble whereas I can still use my laptop and read a book quite conveniently.'The wood base panel is polished very beautifully and the touch sensor is quickly responsive.'The hidden charging port on a side is another attractive point for me to buy this lamp.'
title: 'Perfect Lamp for nights'

If that's the case I would have to say don't buy it, but if the bulb is replaceable it's an excellent buy.

content: 'bI was originally split on whether or not I liked the design of the lamp, but I am very glad I made the spontaneous purchase since the light is really beautiful in person. It seems like the lamp has an air gap between the light's diffuser and the outer shell which creates a very soft glow, yet at the same time is fairly bright. The lamp has the ability to switch between 3 shades of white, specific RGB colors or a fading color pattern with just a tap on the top of the lamp. The lamp also has a built-in battery for portability, and is fairly useful to carry with you to the bathroom during the night. The build quality of the lamp is pretty good as well, but since the exterior shell is plastic you will need to be careful of scratches.

content: 'WHAT I LIKE:' Excellent build quality - the arms are made mostly of metal, as is much of the base - it really feels like a high quality lamp' Very good range of brightness and colour temperature settings, and good granularity of in-between settings. Goes from very dim to very bright - not as bright as a proper overhead light, but bright enough to light up a small to medium sized room well enough to see things relatively clearly. In terms of colour temperature, it goes from very cold (bluish) to very warm (orange). I use it towards the warmer end at night when I m trying to get to sleep, and towards the colder end during the day to maintain a comfortable work or awake environment. As with brightness, there s a good range of settings between the two extremes.' The light is well diffused.' The small night light on the side of the lamp comes in very handy. It s very dim, but is great for when you need to get up to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, for example. Note the night light only has one brightness (quite dim) and one colour temperature (quite orange) setting.' The arm is extremely versatile, allowing you to bend and rotate it into pretty much any position. The base can swivel a full 180 degrees. The lamp itself can also swivel 180 degrees, allowing you to aim it down or to either side (or anything in between). You can t aim it straight up, but hey still pretty darn good. One trick I use is to aim shine right against a lightly coloured (preferably white) wall. Bouncing the light off the wall diffuses it even more than the built-in diffuser, flooding the room with a nice, soft light.' Touch-sensitive buttons look really slick, especially when backlit.' The base of the lamp has a relatively small footprint, so it doesn t take up too much space on the desk (but still gives the lamp good stability).' The maximum height of the lamp is very good for a desk lamp - allows you to get good height above the desk, making for a large illuminated area and also keeping the lamp from getting in the way of other objects on the desk.' The power cord length is 6 ft long, giving you good flexibility in terms of where you can place the lamp relative to a wall outlet. The adapter that plugs directly into the wall is a bit large and might take up more than one outlet, but if you aim it in the right direction or place it at the end of a power bar, this shouldn t be a big deal.' LEDs (in general) save on power and last a very long time (10-20 years, supposedly).' The 2A USB charging port on the side comes in very handy. I plug my phone into it every night to ensure it s charged and ready to go in the morning. Doing this, I can also use one less outlet that I would have otherwise used to charge the phone - this mitigates the size of the wall plug to some extent (see above). Also, many other lamps I looked at were only 1A, which doesn t efficiently charge tablets and many modern phones (especially larger ones).'THINGS THAT COULD BE IMPROVED:' While the touch-sensitive buttons are backlit making it possible to see them in the dark, they are quite bright, which could be annoying if you like a totally dark room. That said, my wife is quite sensitive to light while she s sleeping, and hasn t been bothered by this.' While the touch-sensitive buttons look really nice, they don t have any tactile feel to them. So even with them being backlit, when your hand is poking around in the dark to find the power button, it can be a bit tricky to find the button sometimes.' The only way to turn on the light is by pressing the power button. So when turning it on, it will be the brightness you had it at when last turning it off. This can be an issue if you had it set really bright when turning it off, but don t want to have an abrupt bright light when turning it back on. It would be better if you could also turn it on by pressing the desired brightness button, and have it turn on at that brightness.' It would be slightly better if the power cable connector was right angled, or connected to the side of the lamp instead of the back. As it is, it sticks straight out of the back, so I can t push the base quite as close to the wall as I d like (see attached photo).'OVERALL IMPRESSION: I really love this lamp. It does have some room for improvement, but the issues I ve mentioned are not big deals, and don t detract much from the awesomeness of this lamp. It may sound weird, but I actually *enjoy* using this lamp. I would highly recommend it!'
title: 'Excellent and extremely versatile desk lamp'

Make sure you're aware of their size, they're the height of a sheet of printer paper. I was also worried that they might be too lightweight and easy to knock over. As it turns out they're well balanced but easy to nudge if you're fumbling in the dark and I periodically have to pull mine back towards me because I've gradually nudged it out of reach. I'm planning to put some RC car lead-weights into the base to weigh it down a little more. The bottom is just a sheet of felt glued to the metal, it can be peeled back.

content: 'There are many similar lamps on the market but the extended feature set and the metal construction clinched my choice.The adjustable wide range of colour temperature and illumination level are fantastic and the night light function is a nice bonus.'My only criticisms are minor but I will pass them on in the interest of product improvement. 1. The symbology for controls is a bit confusing particularly the colour temperature adjustment, perhaps a focus group for more universally recognizable symbols would be a good idea. 2.The illuminated controls are a bit bright for someone like me who likes a dark room they give off a bit too much light enough to cast shadows in a dark room. 3. The power jack on the lamp is your typical barrel jack and can easily be pulled out when moving lamp some sort of latch would be a good idea.'Despite my minor criticisms I highly recommend this lamp and would buy it again.'

content: '2 very nice looking bedside lamp at a very decent price. They are almost perfect.'That is, until you realize that the touch function need to trigger the 3 intensity before turning off again.'bThat means if you ever need the lower intensity during the night to check something, you cannot turn it off without bringing it to the highest light setting first. It isn't some gradual light increase either so each step is like a punch in the eye, waking you up.bThen, there is a random issue with only 1 of our 2 lamp. It turns on randomly once every 2-3 day. It can be during the night, it can be during the day when there is no one home or it can happen when you enter the room and see it light up by itself with no one 15' away from it. What a nice way to be waken up in the night, to a light that randomly turns on. Issue only started 2 months after purchase so can't return it. We never dropped the lamps and they didn't move since the purchase.
title: 'Would be awesome if not for 2 major issue'

Just be very careful when taking the plastic off so as not to bend the shade. Not sure if they sell replacement shades. I would definitely buy them again though. Very happy with my purchase overall.'

content: 'bMedium Base A15 Bulb is actually an E26/E27 base. NOT a chandelier bulb. Be careful what you order/buy, as many bulbs will lightly flicker, especially LED's, so it needs to be a <= 60watt dimmable bulb. I had ordered another set from the same manufacturer that used the smaller E10/E11 bulb, so this clarification needs to be clear and bold in the main description for all the sellers lamps. Don't assume the manufacturers other lamps are the same. They are all different.
title: 'Decent enough lamps, there was considerable confusion among buyers as to the size of the bulb base. A15 = E27'

content: 'My least favourite things about it: 1) Raising the angle of the longest arm (the joint near its base), and rotating the swivel at the base of the lamp must be done two-handedly. Every other adjustment (lowering angle of the longest arm, lowering or raising the angle of the LED-arm) can be done single-handedly. But I can t really see how it would be designed otherwise without making it very heavy, or risk drooping. 2) The night-light component is not the most elegant looking (clear plastic cap). It s decent quality though. 3) I wish the temperatures/brightness was even more adjustable (rather than 5 temp settings and 6 brightness settings). 4) I wish the USB port was much higher voltage for fast-charging, or USB-C (for the latest devices). 5) the LED bar is by no means small but I wish it was extra long.'Other than those things, it s really a great lamp. I m a student and read and work a lot. it s large enough to light a huge area of my desk (120x60cm tabletop). The LED bar s cover doesn t let the individual LEDs be visible, the whole thing is uniform in brightness and colour. It s super bright. All the features are as advertised. The metal construction is great. I wanted an LED lamp but I hated all the plasticky goose-neck things I was finding.'The only other lamp I would have considered would be the BenQ WIT e-reading lamp, but that one is $320.'
title: 'probably best value LED lamp for under $70CAD'

content: 'It is all it is advertised to be. 5 light intensity settings both in street light sodium type orange and office light fluorescent white etc. I chosed the 4 setting with white light and that gives me plenty of coverage at my writing desk. The reasons I did not give it 5 stars are: (1) the USB charger is not a rapid charging port which means charging stuff like you android phone, iPhone, iPad etc could take all night. The edges and corners are a little sharp. Not sharp enough to cut if you run your fingers over them but sharp enough to know if a child pull the lamp down on it it will most likely get a cut.'

content: 'I received the lamp today and this is just my first impression. My very first thought was that its much lighter than expected, so while taking the plastic off I was a bit surprised how much more like plastic it felt. The bottom is heavier, so there is no worries of it just tilting and falling aside or such. The overall design is pretty neat and glossy (but attracts dust easily), its a good size and the light covers the major area of my huge desk. The touch sensor works great, one little touch and it turns on and off easily and changes the brightness so effortless. This was my favorite (and obviously the) main part: the different light options. Sure, I looked at the description and read the reviews (and saw pictures) but to have it in front of you is a different experience. I was pleased at the amount of different light levels (which is why I chose this over another one I might have gotten). I am an artist so I needed a white desk light but I absolutely love that I can change it into warm light and therefore increase it into a deeper orange-red. Oh and btw, it does this too and I love it: Adjustable arm, rotating base, and swiveling lamp head for perfect positioning and lighting angle.'I am really happy with purchase!'
title: 'Great purchase'

content: 'Love it. This is just the latest in a long string of happy purchases I have made from Aukey/Anker. Every product I have ever bought from them has exceeded my expectations. I particularly like the ability to adjust the color temp. This made all the difference in the world. The size is good. The unit is good looking.'bA couple of small criticisms: The main vertical neck of the lamp only swivels about 15-20 degrees. If you want the light to be perpendicular to your seating position (as most desk lamps are), you have to turn the base about 45 degrees which takes up more desk space and looks a little weird. The built in USB charger is just 1 amp (strange coming from Anker who makes the best chargers on the market) and the plug is located on the back of the unit in the most awkward spot possible. I didn't buy it for the charger but this is a missed opportunity. If the plug was on the front or even better on the top of the unit it would come in handy from time to time.bOverall, I'm very happy with this lamp and will be checking out Aukey's floor lamps.
title: 'Another Happy Purchase from Aukey/Anker!'

content: 'bI am enjoying this lamp a lot. I love the touch buttons more than I thought I would. It's great when I am done working to just reach over and tap and the light goes out. And when it turns back on it will always go to the last setting it was on. Secondly, the brightness adjustment settings is just wonderful and I have been using them quite a bit. I even found a use for the USB port on the back and I did not think I would have. The multi-swivel head has been nice to me so far but it's definitely the other features of this lamp that I enjoy more. Also the brightest setting is actually quite bright. Exactly what you'd expect from an LED

title: 'bNot the shade of blue that's in the picture

content: 'bThis product was delivered very quickly! I ordered it over the weekend and by Monday morning it was at my door! It came nicely wrapped and arrived in perfect condition. I was really surprised by this lamp! Originally I was thinking of it just for a desk light; however when I plugged it in it has multiple features! The lamp can bend quite a bit ways up and fold down too (great for moving). It has a sturdy solid base and you can swivel the light stem of the light enabling you to focus the light where you need it. As Well, and this in the best part, it has multiple light settings! It has dofgerent colour too, ranging from a soft warm light to a very bright white light. As well, it has multiple brightness levels for each of the light settings so you can customize the light to what your doing. For example, when I'm working on crafts and painting, I need to see the true colour of the paint but having a warm light changes the hue of the paint; how the eye sees it. So for these cases I would use the bright white so it shows the true hue and shade of the paint colour. Also good when you need a bright light to see things more clearer, like say a sliver in the skin or something. Next time that happened to my kids I'll be bringing them over to this lamp so I can actually see it! I also like the warm light as well. It's great for working on the laptop or for reading, instead of having a harsh light. Great for reading in bed too as the soft light won't wake you up light a bright light would. It also has a timer feature and a nightlight feature - which I didn't realize. When the light is turned off there's a small little yellow light that shows you where the night light button is - handy! The lamp has sleek modern, space saving design which would fit in any decor. In fact, given all the great features as well as the night light, I'll likely get another one for my son's room so he can have a light on his desk but also a night light in his room! All in all its a great lamp! I'd definately recommend it to someone looking for a desk/table lamp!
title: 'Multiple Settings makes this a multi purpose light, not just a desk lamp'

content: 'I absolutely love this lamp. The features are so amazing and never ending. First cool thing: the different tones of lighting, from fluorescent to a warmer colour. Secondly, there is a night light feature where only a portion of the lamp is lit up at a dimmer setting. Next, is has a timer so it can automatically shut off after X amount of time. I think it s 30 minutes. AND you can adjust the brightness of the light depending on how much light you need. I m not even done yet. This lamp is just super modern looking. it can fold down to be flat, the just the light portion can rotate as well. I give this lamp 10 stars. I ve never in my life been so enthusiastic about any inanimate object, especially a lamp but this thing is cool.'
title: 'Love it'

content: 'I LOVE this thing!! It does everything I could ever ask for AND MORE!! BEST. LIGHT. EVER. No, seriously, this thing is amazing. Here, let me explain...'- I have it on my sit/stand adjustable desk and the cord is long enough to go up and down with the desk without an extension cord needed. Bonus!'- All the adjustable points make it so I can get it in the perfect position to light up the areas that I need. (The swivel at the base is especially good to have! Not all models that I looked at offered that option.)'- The different colour modes are not something I thought I\'d really need (I just wanted better lighting on my work area, what do I care what colour the light is?!) Well, I have to say, it really does make a difference. (I know, it surprised me too!) I played with the different settings a bit the first day, found a setting that works well for me and hit the favorite button. Each time I turn the light on it comes back to that perfect setting. How cool is that?!?!'- The adjustable dimmer is also handy to have. There are lots of settings to choose from and the brightness level is remembered too.'- This thing is built to last! It is largely made of metal parts (not flimsy plastic), is heavy and fantastic quality!'bAlthough it was pricier than what I was hoping to pay for a desk lamp there really is nothing that I don't like about this light. I highly recommend you give this light some serious consideration if you're in need of a desk light. For me, it is worth every single penny I paid for it!
title: 'Best. Light. Ever.'

content: 'bI don't think you can find a better desk lamp for twice the price of this one. I could not and I looked quite a bit before deciding to buy this one.bIt's very solidly built and nicely designed. It provides a good range of brightness and color temperature and the arm has a wide range of motion. I also like the ability to save a favorite setting. The lamp has a few other features but I don't use them so won't comment on those. A couple of minor things to be aware of:'1. The led bulb is not user replaceable. It is supposed to last for many years but this is obviously not something anyone can easily test now.'2. While quite good the brightness adjustment is not as granular as I would have ideally liked (just 5 steps).'But really, those are very minor nitpicks. A great lamp. Highly recommended.'
title: 'bYou won't find a better lamp for twice the price.

content: 'bLove the light but it immediately looses a star for the oversized plug. It takes up 3 spots on a power bar. Why can't they make smaller plugs like the old days. The timer is a nice option but you can't set the timer on and then have the night lite come on. The night lite will not light if the main lite is in use. The light has 4 colours as follows: bright white, a flatter brighter white, a yellow like a incandescent bulb, and a even more yellow like you are reading by candlelight - each with 5 levels of brightness. I really like its build quality and design. The 2 amp charger is on the base. The extra $20 is worth it and I would recommend this to a friend.
title: 'Almost 5 STARS'

content: 'I use this as a bedside table lamp, for which purpose it is a bit too large, and has too many sharp angles to be very attractive. Definitely not inconspicuous. I keep the top arm mostly folded down, facing the bottom arm, both left vertical. The off-on switch is permanently lighted, and too bright for me at night, so I cover it with a tissue box. The lamp has its own separate night light, up on the top, which is nice, and the many brightnesses and colour changes work OK. I liked my old, un-repairable lamp better: exactly one switch, turned on at lowest light, turn it to the right to brighten, turn left to click completely off, no fuss, no muss, no bother. And with its dimmer, the light change choice was infinite, not just a half dozen choices you grope around for waking up at night. That\'s progress for you!'

content: 'This is a great lamp, has three dimming settings at the touch of the base. Contains two usb ports to recharge phone or my headphones. The switch the cord must be on for these to work. I never turn the switch cord off. I bought four of these for my family. The USB charges in the walls were being crushed by my kids beds, so this is a far better and easier access foe the recharging cables.The bulb comes with the unit.'NOTE: I thought all four were not working, but once the unit is plugged in the soft touch on/off might be in the off position. Once you set it up, touch the base and if it does not turn on, flip the switch and try again.'

title: 'Five Stars'

content: 'I have been looking for bedside lamps since my old IKEA lamps had done their time. I went to several stores and checked out different options but nothing really seem to appeal to me. I stumbled upon these lamps on Amazon and was initially little hesitant given their appearance but decided to give them a try nevertheless. The lamps came in record time shipping was next day, the packaging was of a very high-quality and the lamps had some pretty decent heft to them.'Setting them up is pretty basic you simply remove the plastic wrap charge them using the included micro USB cables and you are good to go. They have two functions with three flush marked buttons on the base, the first button to the left controls your Bluetooth, holding it down will put you into pairing mode and once you go into your device and search for it it should show up on your Bluetooth device list. Simply click pair and you are good to go. You can send any audio from your device to the lamp and it will play from the speaker which is located at the top of the lamp. The sound coming out of the speaker is pretty decent given the size of the lamp I was pleasantly surprised. Odd thing to note is that the lamp asked for permission to sync my phone contacts which I didn t understand as it cannot be used for hands-free calling.'The second flush button controls the key function which is the light, a gentle tap on the button will cycle the lamp through different brightness levels and colours. There are four brightness settings, they range from very dim to fairly bright, the next tap will get you to the colour Red (it is important to note that the brightness cannot be adjusted when you were on the different colours). The final tap will get you to a mode that cycles through different colours in a slow controlled motion. It actually looks very nice and the colour change is gradual. To turn off the lamp you simply long press the second button at any point in the different brightness or colour modes and it will turn off, to turn it back on simply press the same button and it will default to the dim setting.' The final button to the right controls the timer, tapping it once will turn on the timer for 10 minutes and you can go up to 120 minutes. Long pressing the button will cancel the timer. The best thing about this feature is that there are audible responses to let you know what time you have selected and when you cancel the timer.' There is a manual included for your reference if needed, overall I must say I was initially not sold on them but as I have gotten to use the lamps I find that they are growing on me and I now like the ease of use and the different functions. One concern for me initially was not being able to simply touch the lamp to turn it on, however I have since discovered that swiping your fingers (3) on the base at the front will either simply turn on the light at it s dimmest setting or display three lights that correspond to each of the flush buttons discussed earlier and at that point you can choose the option that you want, so even in the dark it would be easy to turn on the light by tapping the button if the swiping action did not turn on the lamp.'I have not use these outside the bedroom but there s absolutely no reason why you could not take them into different rooms depending on what you need, they have a built-in battery and are portable. Be careful not to use them in wet conditions as this is not encouraged. Overall I would highly recommend these especially at the price point they are listed for.'
title: 'Pleasantly surprised!'

content: 'bThis speaker is pretty much exactly what the pictures show. Though it should be made clear that there are only six light options. Four are varying intensities of a warm, white light, one is red, and the final option cycles through colours in a semi-fast pace. While I'm not a fan of the red setting, the rest exceed my expectations.bAs for the sound, the quality isn't amazing, I'd personally pin it around the quality of a car's default stereo speakers, in essence, not as clear as it could be. But for a forty dollar speaker that doubles as a lamp, it's quite good. Additionally, it can get pretty loud so that's a nice plus.

content: 'This is the sturdiest and probably priciest (i.e. I\'m a cheapo) desk lamp I\'ve used. They weren\'t kidding when they advertised metal. Very little plastic is used in the construction, and the entire lamp assembly feels heavy duty and weighty. In the box, you will find the lamp safely secured in packaging foam, along with an AC adapter, user guide/warranty paper, and a microfiber cleaning cloth (for the shiny bits of the lamp).'The lamp itself is pretty easy to use. Top row is brightness adjustment with 6 levels of brightness to choose from. In the bottom row, you\'ve got a power button that is lit (but not overly bright) even when the lamp is off. So you\'ll have no problems turning this lamp on in the dark. There\'s a coffee button for making the white balance more yellow and a book button for making the white balance more blue. With 5 white balance settings in total, you\'d use the coffee and book buttons to cycle up and down the settings. Next to that is a favorite button, which is used to save your most used light setting. Set your lamp to the white balance and brightness you want, and you hold that button for 2 seconds for your settings to get saved into memory. Whenever you press that button, it will automatically go back to that setting. After that, a non adjustable timer button. Press it and the lamp will turn off in 60 minutes. Press it again and it will cancel the timer function. Lastly, a night light button. This turns off the main lamp and turns on the small dim light on the side of the lamp.'At the left side of the base, there is a conveniently placed USB charging port. Goodbye to reaching down below the desk to plug in a charger. With 2.4A of charging power, it manages to charge my S8 with ease.'bThe one small negative to what is otherwise an excellent lamp is the really stiff swivel mechanism, as everyone else has mentioned. Being a desk lamp with swivel capability, you'd think they'd make the swivel part more effortless like 99% of lamps out in the market. In order to swivel the lamp to the direction you want, you'd have to hold the base firmly with one hand, and move (with a bit of strength) the arm using your other hand. Yea.. it's a task requiring both hands just to swivel your lamp. Quite an annoyance when you only need to move the lamp a little bit. I find it takes less effort just to move the whole lamp to the direction I want.. lol.bOverall, this is a beautifully crafted, functional and sturdy lamp that is worth its price tag. It's only let down is the stiff swivel mechanics. 4.5/5
title: 'Heavy duty metal lamp. Swivel requires two hands :('

content: 'Great light, has night light feature with a dim warm glow. The main light can control brightness and colour temperature. A favorites setting can be programmed and a timer off can be programmed, as well.'The light seems well built and very sturdy, even when rotating the head, arm or base.'The base is light so you will have to hold it down when you need to rotate the light.'Overall, good light, and will probably get another one if the price goes down.'
title: 'Great Light, lots of features, base too light to swivel with one arm'

content: 'bI'm really happy with this premium-feeling LED lamp.bI received this lamp yesterday and so far I'm really happy with it. I used it last night to read by.bThe packaging for the lamp is definitely premium - way better than I expected, especially given the price (which I think is very good). As you'll see from my photos, it came without any damage to the external box (it's not in an Amazon box, since it's so well packaged already I guess; less waste is a good think). Inside the lamp is really well packed - plenty of polystyrene around the lamp, and the lamp itself has thin plastic film over all the surfaces, so there is absolutely no scuffing or marring of the glossy finish.bInstallation was a breeze, just plug it in and check the clear instructions for what each button does. The only thing that confused me for a moment was the brightness - I was touching the bottom and top of the dimmer slider, and thought it only had two settings. Actually it's a cool slider bar, so you can set it to whatever brightness you want.I love the colour warmth setting. During the day for working I want a bright light, but at night a warm light to read by - the six settings give me exactly what I wanted.'bI charged my phone (Samsung Galaxy S7) overnight using the USB charging port, and it charged quickly and the lamp/phone didn't heat up. Saves having something extra plugged in at my bedside table.bFinally, the lamp has a good reach - you can extend it forwards so that you can use a dimmer setting to read by, since it's closer to your Kindle or book.
title: 'bI'm really happy with this premium-feeling LED lamp

content: 'Functionally, its a god send for me.'Different lighting + type of lighting for late nights helps a ton. Dont need my room light on'Build wise, its plastic. If you do that it should last.'As you can see in the picture, dust wants tk be its best friend so have those wipes ready if it bothers you, but not a big deal. Finger print magnet yea, but again, you can wipe them off.'They make a good headphone stand, but be gentle.'Night lamp mode is really neat, dont need to walk around my room in tge middle of the night fearing the safety of my toes.'Price is a bit too steep for me. Now lets see if the lifespan matches the price.'bI would buy it again. I'd. Just prefer more sturdy materials for the body instead of plastic

content: 'The lamp itself is good for a bedside lamp. It casts decent light and the sliding dimmer is useful.'The materials are a bit light and plastic feeling. Overall the design of the lamp is sleek.'I like the wireless charger but as other reviews will attest, if you are listening to music via the speaker built into this lamp it is possible your phone may slide off due to vibration of the ..bit light and plastic feeling.. material. I am certain that a little strip of rubber or even a chunk of kin tape would prevent the slide but its a thing.'bWe bought two, one for each side of the bed, now that is important to note because of the speaker issues in other reviews. The speaker does have good sound but there is a missing right channel. I found however that by utilizing my phone's ability to cast to 2 bluetooth speakers at once that the sound now appears to be in mock-stereo.I find that the black of the base and the inside of the top collect dust rather quickly, just a reality of having black instead of another surface type/colour.'bAll in all, I don't hate the product, it's modern and sleek with some weird natural inferences and the light and sound are decent with wireless charging all packed into an unassuming small lamp.
title: 'Modern with Natural Touches, Light & Sound & Wireless Charging all in One'

content: 'bWith this purchase, I didn't expect stereo. However, if you listen to music that is heavily mixed in stereo (i.e. 60s rock, Beatles, Doors, etc) you should know that my recent delivery faithfully plays the right channel ONLY, making songs mixed in stereo sound thin and missing something. Thus a 4 or 5 star product is merely and sadly a 2.

content: 'A floor lamp for 23 bucks? Yes sir. I think this lamp is definitely worth the sale price. The setup is very easy, 5 minutes tops and you will barely need to consult with the manual, which features clear, well laid out drawings by the way.The light is bright with my own supplied 40W bulb (this specific package does not include the bulb), but because the lamp is 46 inches tall the light will not spread across the shade evenly. Its brightest in the middle and less bright towards the top and the bottom, which is just fine aesthetically. You may consider a more powerful bulb for this kind of light.'bSpeaking of looks, the only downside is the lamp's shade which is pretty much paper and comes folded so it's wrinkly when you take it out. No big deal because you will stretch it - it stretches quite easily with no tears - as you install it on the lamp. The wrinkles will disappear quickly while stretched, but what remains is just a plain, white lamp paper shade. When NOT lit, it's a bit spartan and kind of boring in my book. I suppose a minimalist would like this. I think I would have preferred an oriental design, or any other tasteful design, to go with an oriental lamp like this, to give it the extra oomph. As it stands, this is still an outstanding value for a floor lamp and I'm glad I have it.
title: 'Oustanding Value for a Solid Floor Lamp, With Just A Single Drawback'

content: 'bIm thinking I'll need one for each room. Sleek, small but powerful. High power is strong enough for reading, low mode is mood setting and relaxing. No searching for the switch under the shade. Has a very contemporary look. The color changes can be changed to match the color scheme of your room. Easy to dust. Takes up very little room on the end table. Love, love, love. My favourite purchase in many months
title: 'Powerful to mild lighting in a quick touch. Great value'

content: 'Easy to set up and easy to use. It s very portable. Can be used anywhere with an outlet. I like the design of it. The ring on top is the area to touch to turn light on / change brightness. My toddler knows how to use it as well which is a bonus. We use it in the bathroom as a night light because our toddler is too sensitive to standard brightness of a light in the middle of the night. This is a very good alternative. We could still see everything in the room without worrying about hurting our eyes.'
title: 'Set up is easy and design is sleek'

content: ' This lamp is a smaller size but gives off a lot of light, both of which I love! We have ours in our bedroom for watching TV at night. The lowest setting for light is perfect. In the morning, it is great to have the brightest setting on when getting ready for the day.'bIt is easy to operate, just touch the metal ring on the top of the lamp. Push for each brightness level (3 levels) or hold down to start the color cycle (very pretty colors). This lamp would work great for lighting rooms that don't have a ceiling light
title: 'touch table lamp'

content: 'bI bought this light as a bedside light for my daughter and a similar product from Aukey for my son. My daughter absolutely loves her light. She had first choice and wanted this light over the Aukey for the RGB. The pro's about this light are the RGB bulb that is included, lower cost, and smaller size. I would say the only minor con is the light switches between three levels rather than dims; however, the levels do work well for reading or brightening up the room when needed (e.g., practicing guitar) so this is minor and some might see it as a plus since it is quicker to change output. So far so good and I would certainly buy another one.
title: 'Great bedside light.'

content: 'I got this lamp as a housewarming gift for my brother, who recently moved into an apartment. We were both pleasantly surprised by the quality of the entire product - from the very classy packaging, to the quality of the lamp itself!'- The lamp is made with high quality materials, the wooden bark texture lamp shade looks amazing in real.'- Sound quality for the Bluetooth speaker is comparable to my JBL speaker at home, solid sound and volume.'- Wireless charging is fast, and works instantly when you put down your phone.'- Overall design is unique and well built, it creates great ambiance in the room'- Dim light function lets you use it as a night-light as well'- multi-function furniture piece that is excellent for small home!'bMy brother loved it so much that he said it's the best housewarming gift he got!
title: 'Quality is beyond my expectation!'

content: 'The lamp is really beautiful and works as described. The one down side for me was that the surface is very smooth, and my phone keeps vibrating out of place. I can actually watch my phone slowly slide off the sensor, which then sets off the light. I ve managed to fix it by putting something else at the front of the lamp to hold the phone in place. The Bluetooth also works very well and is a nice alarm clock in the morning. I contacted the manufacturer about the slippery surface and suggested a small piece of rubber on the surface would hold the phone on place better. They were very responsive to my concerns and contacted me immediately.'I have now had it for 4 months, and it has been a bit finicky from the beginning. I put an elastic band on the sensor to hold my phone in place which resolved that problem. But now, after 4 months, it won t recognize my phone on the charger any more. I put my phone on the charger, and it just keeps beeping at me, and turning the light on. Super frustrating as this wasn t a cheap lamp/charger.'
title: 'Beautiful lamp.. however, it hasn t been without its problems.'

content: ' People nowadays are inseparable from mobile phones, and they only put their phones aside when they charge the phone and sleep at night.'When you turn on the lamp, the soft light appears. At the same time Bluetooth is connected to the phone, open the music software, play a wonderful song, put the phone on the base for wireless charging.'bThe whole room quickly created a sleeping atmosphere, helping people to release the stress of a day's work and slowly enter the dream.This is my impression of this versatile combination bedside lamp. It meets all my usage habits, and the bedside table is no longer messy. It looks beautiful, everything is so elegant.'
title: 'Elegant bedside lamp'

content: 'You will love this lamp, if you already have an Oriental theme at home (Japanese, Vietnamese, Thai etc)'The exact height of the lamp fully assembled is about 3 feet and a half tall. Makes it a good floor lamp for a corner.'This is a one light bulb lamp, and the materials are Rice Paper & Black Metal.'You can also put it on a pedestal, or a table etc, if you want to give the room a different feel,'and for the lamp to be higher. Keep in mind though that the on/off switch is just like in the picture.'Its a foot switch, for the floor, about 20 inches from the lamp.'I love mine, it fits well in my Japanese theme dinning room.'
title: 'A good oriental lamp.'

content: 'bI think it's unfair to call this a nightlight. It is incredibly bright even on the lowest setting. It glares very bright when it's in your field of vision, and the colour settings are also very deep and again, far too bright. My pic was taken using flash and is not illustrative of the dimness or brightness.bI purchased this because it indicates on the website description a nightlight and a dim setting. I wouldn't consider it dim at all. Wish I knew how many lumen, but I couldn't say.bWhy all the glowing, happy comments?! Seems like anyone will do anything for a bit of free. Based on the included card, I don't think you can take everything at face value. Enough said. You be the judge.My 3-stars is because of the misrepresentation in the description and the inappropriate paper that was included.'Thinking about returning it.'

content: 'Whether used as a desk lamp or a bedside lamp, this lamp is really practical for all everyday uses. The finishes are impeccable and the materials used are of good quality, in this case a shiny rigid plastic of the most beautiful effect. The foot is robust and ensures good stability, all the elements of the arm are independently adjustable from the base horizontally on 80 and vertically up to 90 , the lamp holder on 135 and the lamp itself to 180 from one side to another.It is possible to adjust the tone of light on 5 modes of bright white to warm yellow and the intensity on 7 levels for each mode. The manufacturer also has a timer mode that stays on for 60 minutes as well as a night-light mode that turns on only a few LEDs for low light. All functions are accessible via touch keys on the lamp base. In addition, a built-in USB port on the back of the stand can charge his smartphone directly on the lamp. This function is very convenient that the lamp is used near the bed or desk.In conclusion, it is a product with impeccable finishes, convenient to use and the price is fully justified.'
title: 'The finishes are impeccable and the materials used are of good quality, in this case a shiny rigid plastic ...'

The final joint which is for the illuminating head to swivel, seems to sag a tiny bit, and could be a possible future area of concern.'I have also noticed that over an extended period of time during use, the top of the lamp gets decently hot.'The touch sensors are so nice, the night light is a great feature (timer and all), and being able to change the COLOR of the light is so nice.'bAs some other people have mentioned, the power touch button does stay illuminated, which at night can be a problem if you don't fall asleep quickly.I really do enjoy this lamp :)'
title: 'This, is a good product.'

content: 'Background: I bought this about a month ago for my work desk and have been using it daily since.'bLight Quality and Options (5/5): As described. The dimming levels are perfect for reading up to working depending on needs. The ability to change the warmness as worked quite well for me as when I'm writing reports I prefer the more Warm setting and when I'm reading, the Cold setting seems nice. The options mean you can split the difference and always find the one that suites you best. BONUS: The USB Port on the back - this sucker charges my Galaxy S7 quite fast!! Can confirm, awesome addition.bBuild Quality (4/5): Pretty awesome build quality. The hinges seem like they'll last quite a while and the light easily collapses if you have a minimalist desk and need room. Only negative is it scratched a bit easy and the stem on mine is a bit wonky but not enough to notice under static use.bPackaging: Doesn't matter too much so I won't rate it; will just say that it was packed fantastic and isn't overly flashy because... who is going to put a box on display anyways?bSummary: Phenomenal light! The combination of multiple brightness and warmness settings means you'll always have the setting you need plus the extra USB port is nice!
title: 'b1 Month Review - Won't find anything better for the price!

content: ' Compact and bright, this desk lamp is useful because it can move so you can find the right angle to bring you light for reading, working or just for watching TV.'The base can rotate about 30 on each side and the lamps head can be swivel up to 90 . It's like a low light night. There is also a one-hour timer. The desk lamp is dimmable and it is control by touch (tap or slide to increase or decrease light strength. There are 5 lighting pre-sets (cool, ambient, natural, warm and golden) to suit different situations.This desk lamp is convenient in a wide range of activities and it s easy to move it from room to room. Easy to store too while the head and the arm can completely laying down.'

content: 'b What an exquisite desk lamp. This is perfect for my needs. Super bright when you need it to be, and dim when you don't! Because I live in a basement, I keep it on almost the whole day. I can turn it up brighter to see the words under a warmer colored light so it's not too bright to hurt eyes. When I sleep, I can turn it up yellow light which will not disturb my sleeping. I also love its design because it is user-friendly. The adjustable neck is great so I don't have to rotate the base to move the whole thing away from where I'm sleeping. It has LED lighting which is cool to the touch. In addition, the USB port is a bonus. When I need to look at my phone and work on my homework at the same time, I do not need a wall charger for my phone because the desk lamp can provide power to my phone.

content: 'bTo begin with, the lamp was nicely packaged in the box with all surfaces covered by plastic wrap. The lamp looks very elegant on a desk, more so when matched to a dark coloured surface. The glossy plastic makes dust quite visible when lamp is turned on. (A quick sweep would resolve that easily.) I don't notice fingerprints as I keep my hands clean and I don't move/adjust my lamp often if ever. It is very lightweight and most of the weight is in the base to keep it nice and sturdy. The swivelling head of the lamp was a key feature I was looking for. The arm connecting to the base doesn't rotate very much so you might need to move the entire lamp in certain scenarios. All the touch controls are very responsive and does what you expect.bI personally don't use the USB port so I can't comment on it but its nicely hidden in the back. The max brightness is brighter than I expected and lights up my entire desk evenly under complete darkness. The warmth of the light can be changed and has one to fit every situation. LEDs maintain a low temperature even if turned on for long periods of time (unlike incandescence bulbs) and reduces the risk of burning yourself. When the lamp is off, there is a pixel sized orange light illuminated which turns on the 'Night Light' when pressed. I found this feature too dim to be useful for anything other than helping me find the power button. The timer function may be handy for those who sleep with lights on. The lamp maintains the last settings you chose which should be a standard in every lamp.Overall I highly recommend this lamp to anyone looking for a simple desk lamp.'
title: 'Functional Yet Stylist Desk Lamp'

content: 'bI used this to replace a halogen desk lamp. I like that you can change it from cool to warm lighting based on how you want to use it, as well as being dimmable. The night mode button for the low light setting is handy and I'm glad that there is a small LED where the button is. The surface is smooth, so it's very difficult to find the buttons in the dark, so the night mode will illuminate it enough to see the buttons to press when you are in a dark room.bOverall, it's a great energy saving alternative to a traditional desk lamp.
title: 'Great energy saving alternative to a traditional desk lamp'

content: 'b I Absolutely LOVE everything about the TryLight Dimmable LED Desk Lamp from the FUNKY design to the functionality. To start with it's an extremely attractive lamp which you can bend and mold to the exact desired look you wish to achieve this also alters the intensity of the light given off as you can angle the LED light facing down for a dimmer effect or straight up so that it illuminates the entire room.bI LOVE that the TryLight LED Desk Lamp has 4 different brightness settings from low to blue night light. To change settings you simply touch the lamp itself the desired amount of time. Another really cool feature TryLight has incorporated into It's desk lamp design is that this lamp will function for up to 8 hours without being plugged in as it comes equipped with a rechargeable battery hence it's easily portable so u can take it with you to different areas of the home or office easily. The blue nightlight will last up to 14 hours!!!I LOVE this LED Desk Lamp so much I ordered another so I have modern and attractive end table lights. If your looking for a unique, efficient & adaptable lamp look no further as the TryLight LED Desk Lamp has it ALL! Very impressed with this product and shocked that it costs so little.'
title: 'Perfectly Designed & Portable'

content: 'AUKEY has done it again!'bBought this lamp and chose the standard shipping which was 5-8 days later. The lamp showed up 2 days later and I couldn't have been more satisfied with it! Easy packaging and even easier to install! It has got 5 light versions/modes. Each light mode can be increased or decreased in brightness. The timer button turns off the lamp in 1 hour. The moon icon is basically for night light. The lamp remembers the last light version/mode and the brightness intensity, which is great! The light mode ranges to bright white to yellowish hue.bThe only (very minor) con is that when the lamp is off, the moon icon is lit, which is great. But when I need to turn on the lamp, in the dark, I first have to turn on the night light, locate the power button (second one in product pic) and then press it to get the lamp to turn on. So, just an extra minor step involved to turn the lamp on when it's really dark. But this is very minor.bOverall, I am extremely happy with this lamp and I will say that it's probably one of the best ones I've ever bought. As of this review, I've had the lamp for a week and have been using it on a regular basis. I would buy this again!
title: 'Fantastic AUKEY lamp!'

content: 'bThe lamp produces a soft yet surprisingly nice amount of light considering it's small size. content: 'I hate when there is only one, very confusing review-stream for multiple products, posted by the same Seller, so please note that I am reviewing the LED Battery Powered Strip-LIght, ASIN B07VBC2JCJ, by Honesorn.'This has got to be the best Motion Detecting LED strip-light for the price, that I have ever purchased, and I have purchased multiple versions of Solar, AAA, Button-Cell and Li-Ion USB-Rechargeable motion detecting LED strip lights over the past 5 years.'The fact that you can choose your colour temperature; how bright the lights are when on, AND if you want them to turn on in semi-light, vs. dark conditions ... makes these the best featured light, for the best price, that I have ever purchased and used.'I bought 3 of them on my first order, just based on the stated functions alone, because I know what I have been purchasing these past 5 years.'So far, these are the best lights. 'I am now giving my older, early-generation motion detecting, battery operated, closet LED strip-lights, to my relatives and friends, as I plan to buy more of these '
title: '5 for the LED Motion-Detecting USB-Rechargeable Closet Light B07VBC2JCJ.'

content: 'Works great! I would recommend this product. light levels are great for baby s nursery on low and perfect brightness on high. Battery life is great, charger included, plug into a USB charger square (charger square not included). Lamp is smaller than I expected but quality is very good. Colours are vibrant yet soft. Easy to use and no set up required. Tap the top to turn on and off, light level up and down on front. To change colour tap the middle button then up or down to change.
