Also it has a touch pad on top to turn on and off the light, but the light turns off when I move it. Even when I'm just holding the sides. Other than that I love this little light!

content: 'bI was surprised at the size of the lamp when it arrived, it was smaller them I expected but that was from online pictures and not checking the dimensions. I am now very happy with the size. It fits easily on the shelf beside the chair so it can be plugged in. If I need more light by the change table I unplug it and move it over. There are 3 brightness settings and I use them all. It is a nice added feature that you can also change the colour of the light, I don't do it often but its very nice. It's easy to turn the light on and off by touching the top and to use the stetting buttons on the front to change colour and brightness. The one thing that I was not impresses with was the battery life. You can have it unplugged for a long time, probably most of the might. If you forget to plug it it to charge and the batter dies you can not use the light while it is charging so there my be some time you do not have a light. Most of the time it is plugged in and it has not been an ongoing issue. I really like this touch light for my babies room for night feedings and diaper changes.
title: 'Baby Nursery Lamp!'

Sometimes I would wake up in the middle of the night and the colours will be on. Happens about 2-3 times a day.'
title: 'Light Automatically Turns On All The Time!!!'

content: 'bThis is a good lamp contextualised specifically by the price; it is the price that matters in this review. If it was over 36 bucks I wouldn't have given it 4 stars as it is only a good lamp insofar as it is priced well. The three setting of normal light are good enough for a bedside light, although it could be a bit more warm in the colour department which is my bias, and the RGS feature is decent enough. The controls for the regular light are perfectly fine where you just touch it to cycle between the three settings although the RGB feature is implemented in a way that you have to let it cycle through the colours every time you want to set a certain colour which can be a PITA if you don't regularly use red (which just happens to be the colour I bought it for) as it stars from there and slowly goes through all the colours until you tap it to stop on a colour.So, the build quality is objectively good. The standard settings for and operation of the normal touch light are perfectly fine.. Controlling the specific colour can be a hassle as there is no direct way to a colour other than red and the colour setting only has one brightness which some people might not like.'In conclusion if you are in the market for a cheap bedside lamp with an RGB function this is probably your best choice although if you have a few more bucks to spend you might want to buy one with a remote which would allow you to go straight to specific colours and also have brightness control for the coloured lights.'bI am happy I bought this lamp as it fits my specific needs quite well but I could easily see this rated as either a 5 or a 3 for depending on what someone wants out of a lamp so consider these points before buying to see where you think you'll land.bEdit: After about a year the lamp just stopped receiving power and was rendered useless without any foul play; it had just sat on my desk. Since I registered it with Aukey when I purchased it all I had to do was send a video of the issue and my Amazon order number to get a replacement sent out to me. I didn't have to send the broken one back as I had proved it was broken while once they sent it out it only took a couple of days to get here. Excellent support from Aukey is now another reason to buy their products for me.
title: 'Great inexpensive bedside lamp with some limitations'

content: 'An excellent product, in design, performance and value for money. Even the packaging displays the quality and care taken in manufacturing. I have purchased two of these units and friends who have seen them have purchased another 5 between them. The substantial base, metal flexible arms and heavy duty hinges make for a robust unit. The choice of warm or cool light, variable intensity, auxiliary night light and USB port provide maximum convenience and versatility. One observation, not a criticism, is that if you need a pair of lamps for either side of a double bed, they do not exactly match. On one side of the bed the auxiliary night light will be facing out and on the other side it will be facing in. A similar and slightly cheaper desk lamp from the same company, does not have the night light option and so will form a matching pair. It too has a well-earned high rating. I purchased this unit based on the many positive reviews and thoughtful comments. The testimonials are well justified. You will not be disappointed if you buy this lamp.'
title: 'An excellent product, in design'

content: 'bBought as a nightlight for my sons room. The smaller ones were not bright enough to keep him calm. The touch function works great and flawless. It is bright enough for us to read a book with the lamp across the room. Don't expect it to flood your room with light thou. It is not intended to be a primary source of illumination for a room. We are so pleased with it that we are considering replacing our bedside lamps.

content: 'Lamp is as described. Works perfectly. Very bright at max setting which is what I wanted (many of these LED lamps are quite weak). It easily lights up a standard sized office desk plus you can adjust the lighting type from warm (soft yellow light) to cold (blueish white light). Personally I find the second or third (of five) lighting intensities is fine for most of my needs but its great to have the extra lighting power when you need it. Lamp is very high quality, well built, very sturdy metal construction. Looks teriffic. Have not used the timer function.'
title: 'High quality LED desk lamp with beauty and power'

content: 'This lamp was on sale so I got a couple because I noticed that there were several dark corners in our new house and being both artistic and readers, the light is always welcome.'On top of that, we had a winter power outage and a lot of our charging lights weren t working anymore. These lights ARE chargeable so that was the first selling point. They plug into any USB plug. Some people seem to think this is a downside but I love how versatile USB chargers are between power towers and laptops I am way more likely to have a USB near me than a regular plug.'It has a cute sort of futuristic squiggly flower base that glows blue as a night light. It has three settings of brightness that turn up with a tap. If I hold my finger down it turns the blue light on or off.'In full bright with the night light it stays on for a good four hours before it starts to dim.'The lamp is flexible and bends to any shape and I need and works great to prevent casting shadows when I m drawing.'I love this lamp! I love the price! I ve already bought a second one and I ll probably buy a few extras for those other corners of my house!'If you haven t got a power tower, they re the power bars of the 21stt century and absolutely awesome they come with USB plug ins and surge protectors. Definitely time to come into the new century before it s the 22nd century lol!'
title: 'Perfect charging lamp for dim corners of your house!'

content: 'Amazing product!!! So beautiful !!' I was so happy from I opened the amazon box. Nice package, every single detail to my eyes on the lamp, all even nicer than my expectation. Bluetooth speaker, table lamp and wireless charger . All I needs for my bedroom and all works well for me . My bedroom looks upgraded now . Also, thank you the seller for the fast shipping . 100% recommended !!!!'
title: 'Amazing product!!!'

Overall, I think it's worth its value!

content: 'bSignificantly smaller than you'd think. Not super bright. Speak is excellent though, like surprisingly good. Overall way too expensive for what it is but at the same time I like it enough to not return it....

content: 'bI purchased this light for my son's room to use as a night light. He is 5 and loves being able to adjust the color and brightness before he goes to bed! I like how you can regulate the brightness so it's great to use the lowest setting for bedtime and he can use the brighter setting for when he is in his room playing!
title: 'Perfect nightlight!'

content: 'bI received this today and probably had too much fun playing with the colours. It's really easy to use and compatible with my Alexa, sensitive to touch, and gives me soft light when when I'm up late on my computer as well as a brighter setting if I want to read. I definitely recommend.
title: 'Best Desk/Side Table Lamp'

content: 'Small and modern. A very soft light, more for a nightlight or perhaps for taking a bath etc. You can not read with this light unless it s on the table right beside your book. I got as a reading light beside my bed and I don t think it s going to be bright enough. Will use in other areas as it s easy to move around. Colour function is soft and actually fairly nice.'
title: 'Portable, nice ambience, not very bright'

content: 'The look:'bIt looks greats, even when it's off. They are 3 brightness levels of warm white and a color rotation mode that can be pause on any color.I position mine on my computer desk, not too far from my screens. It loom amazing at light with any white or colors. My favorite is to keep it in the color rotation mode. The color rotation is very smooth, you can almost feel the color degradation from the top to the bottom of the lamp.'The functionality:'bIt's simple to use.The metallic base is fully touch sensitive. That mean anywhere you touch it would activate it (all around).'One touch to turn in ON to the softest white and then any repeated touch will cycle through the brightness levels (of white) and the forth touch will turn it off.'A long touch (2-3 seconds) will turn on the color mode. This works if the light is already on or off. In the color mode, a touch will pause it on the current color. If you touch it again it will continue though the color mode. Another 3 seconds touch will turn it off.'There is no other control and it feels perfect with way, I love how they made them.'The quality:'The quality is where I almost removed a star (I would actually give it 4.5/5).'bThe lamp and the base feels like good quality and it's the most important part since it's what you see and use the most.The power cable felt a little cheap and is a little bit short.'bThe power connector on my lamp was off centered (the hole on the base wasn't perfectly aligned with the port). I still managed to connect the lamp and it works great.
title: 'A great lamp'

Then I found this Lamp!'This was EXACTLY what I was looking for and the customer service from this company (AUKEY) is AMAZING!'Buy in confidence, you will not regret it!'AMAZING LAMP, EXACTLY WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR!'

content: 'bMore than once I found myself working on a project and would need better lighting. I was not always in a situation where having a large lamp plugged into a socket was conducive. I picked up this light for these situations and it's performed quite well. Battery powered with a flexible head, it essentially solved my lighting issues. Lately, I've been using it while working on a sculpture and its been great. There are a few small things I would change to make it better, but all in all its doing exactly what I need it to do.Pros:'b Pretty decent battery life. I'll get more than a few days of usage from a single charge Flexible shaft allows you to fine tune where you need light the most.' Casts plenty of light on the highest setting' Has a glowing base that can be turned off and on. This could work great for a nightlight' Rechargeable by USB makes it portable and easy to use.'CONS'b Has 3 light settings but I find I'm always using the highest setting as I tend to find the lower settings too dimb base is not quite heavy enough meaning the light can tip over sometimes if it's stretched out too far.
title: 'A handy rechargeable led light'

content: 'January 2019 UPDATE: I have never had a lamp I ve had to replace so often.... I don t think I ve had a lamp I had to replace at all. Less than a year after receiving a replacement it has stopped working again. As good as the customer service is I think think I ll purchase this lamp again. It really is a disappointment because I love it, except for the fact it stops working. Shedding a tear for this lamp 'UPDATE: Aukey support quickly rectified the issue. They sent me a new lamp free of charge but also refunded me for the first lamp! I m very impressed with them. Months later they messaged me again to make sure my lamp was is still working and to offer me any aukey $20 product for free.'The lamp itself still works and is exactly what I need, I will definitely purchase more. But I did deduct one star as the first lamp didn t work.'April: I absolutely loved this lamp, but I received it April 2nd and now April 11th it won t turn on. Not impressed.'

BUT... the light keeps turning on by itself. Sometimes just a couple times a day or sometimes a couple times an hour. I ve only had it for over a week now.'I see a couple of other people are having this problem too. I ve tried putting it on different surfaces and all the other solutions. content: 'bLoved this purchase! I bought it to replace a large touch lamp I have on my bedside table and much prefer the compactness and cool white lighting of the AUKEY to my old lamp. I don't have much use for the color spectrum on it, but bought it mainly for the purpose of having three levels of white lighting. I don't get bothered by the blue lighting of the base when it's off at night; I guess it just depends on how light a sleeper you are and how important having complete darkness in your room is to you. I have noticed that there's been a few times where the touch base hasn't responded to my attempts to cycle through the 3 levels of light to turn it off, but eventually I've been able to succeed in turning it off. Switching it over to the color spectrum and then turning it off from there worked. As others have stated, the white light (and even the colored light) is very bright, and you'll have no problem reading by it. I have a fairly large bedroom and it does a very good job of lighting up the whole room during the evening.
title: 'Minimalist Lamp with a Great Light Range'

The reading and relax modes are more of a warmer yellow-orange light. Also super convenient having a USB port on the side of the lamp. content: 'bLet me start off by saying: this lamp is awesome! It features bright LED lighting, dimmable light settings, a USB charging port and it has great flexibility. It has a very flexible neck which is handy and it keeps its charge for quite a good amount of time. I have tried several other options and this is definitely the best one

And problems are happeningb- it has started to make a weird buzzing noise every minute or so. It's not very loud but as I'm typing this review it is buzzing- sometimes the blue light will turn on for no reason. I would be across the room and the blue light will just turn on?? Im pretty sure there arent any ghosts trolling me..'bI hope this light lasts long enough to feel worth it but I'm worried since things are happening after only a few months of gentle use.
title: 'Things to consider'

content: 'There is one downside with this lamp, having had it for a month. I discovered a high pitched sound coming from the base of it. I had read another comment to this effect, but bought in anyway, thinking it would probably not be an issue. Well, it is. I now have to unplug it every night when we are trying to sleep, because once you hear it, it is totally annoying. It sounds like a miniature hamster cage spinning around inside the base. My wife has the same lamp and it does not seem to have the same problem (as yet).'bSince writing this review, this sound stopped completely on its' own, and I am a happy buyer and user, once again.

content: 'I love the adjustability of this lamp and the weight of it. It works great above my desk lighting up everything below. The light levels and colours are perfect depending on the time of day and the USB port and nightlight are a nice bonus. I love it so much my mother bought herself one!'

content: 'bI really like the build of the lamp and the light that it gives off, but I have had electrical issues with it right out of the box. It will randomly turn itself off and on while running, even when I just have it plugged in but not turned on. I've had to get up several times in the middle of the night when the lamp turned on full brightness when I forgot to unplug it before going to bed. I dragged my feet on returning it as it seemed like an issue that I could fix on my end, I'm now out of my return window and regretting buying this in the first place.
title: 'I really like the build of the lamp and the light that ...'

content: 'It does wirelessly charge my galaxy s10 with a thin rubber case on. Bluetooth connection often disengages randomly. I also wish the unit was bigger.'
title: 'Way too overpriced for what you get.'

content: 'bI can't sing enough praises about this lamp.As a writer who doesn\'t use home row, I need the keyboard lit in the evenings. This light has such a wide periphery that it sits 50 cm from my keyboard and still lights it well, even on sunny days.'bIt has 4 different lighting styles which is fantastic. The LED's in this unit are mostly white, but there are some yellow LED's in it too. So if you need to stay awake writing a paper, you can turn it to all-white and crank up the brightness. If you're resting from some intense writing or studying, you can set it to a more yellow tint to relax. 5 brightness settings on each lighting style really make this an indispensable desk lamp.bI loved it so much, I ordered a second one to replace the banker's lamp on my journaling desk.bThere is not a single disappointment with this lamp. It's everything you want a lamp to be and even includes a 1 hour sleep timer. Heck, it even comes with a small polishing cloth!bI'm absolutely thrilled with this lamp. Sometimes you happen upon a product that is so absolutely perfect, you feel like you should buy 10 of them in case it becomes discontinued and your lamps start to break. I haven't gone that far, but believe me, this lamp will NOT disappoint you.Great for students, writers, readers.'
title: 'BEST lamp for students, writers, and readers.'

content: 'I bought this after see a friend have a similar one from Anker. Liked the bright light and compact style.'Quality - 10/10. Very good build. Hinges are strong and durable. Doesn t feel cheap. Nice colour gloss. The light has bright to dim settings which is great.'Performance- great response. Buttons all work. Love the USB port on the side. I now use it to Power my google home mini. Has enough power to power that so pretty good quality. Brightness is amazing. Even the sleep Light has a nice orange sunset tint to it.'Overall. Great product. Only thing I would'Have loved is maybe additional colour options.'Enjoy!'

content: 'bLove it. Much preferred over the incandescent lamps. This one is so much easier to clean compared to the desk lamp I threw away. It's also a lot lighter in weight. Also very neat how I can dim, or brighten the light how I want. It lasts a ridiculously long time without needing to be charged (weeks when being used nightly for short durations to read at bedtime). The light is soft enough to use it to read at night, but bright enough to provide a good desk lamp. The blue is a nice touch as a night light. We're looking forward to using it in the tent this summer as we are confident the blue light will last all night. Excellent product.

content: 'Updated Review: when the folks at Aukey read here that we were having problems with our Aukey lamp they reached out directly to me and followed the email by shipping us free of charge a replacement lamp. Very impressive customer service! As a result Ive upgraded my rating of this item as their customer service was so amazing. I think I ve purchased at least 10 or 15 Aukey products over the last few years from Amazon and never had a problem before - the lamp issue may have been a fluke. Well done Aukey customer service on stepping up! It s obvious to me that the company stands behind its products and want its customers to be happy and satisfied.'Our second lamp just died. I had convinced my wife that these were a great replacement for our old reliable IKEA bedroom lamps but the first one I bought here died within a week or two of arrival (Aukey replaced it luckily) and now her bedside lamp has died. She refuses to spend any more money on these or to allow me to buy her a replacement. Looks like we are heading back to Ikea... (I really tried, Aukey, believe me)'

content: 'Purchased as a bedside light, and chose this because of the dimmable feature.'The light is quite bright, which might be a pro for many people.'bColor mode also sets a nice ambience for the room. Would've liked to choose brightness on the color mode as well, but you can only choose one brightness on color mode.bTouch is fairly responsive, and feels like it's all made from pretty good materials.Unfortunately the dimmest is still too bright for my personal preference. I wanted to use the lamp as a dim, bedside lamp to unwind and eventually fall asleep to, but the light emitted from the lamp is overwhelming and rather a distraction.'bIf you are looking for a more dim light, this product is probably not for you. But if you want something cool to set the ambience of the room, this might be what you're looking for.
title: 'Very bright'

content: 'This lamp performed essentially precisely as described. I was a bit confused initially, thinking that it should come apart in order to replace a bulb but that is not the case. There is no bulb to replace and the lamp is reputed to last for several thousand hours. It\'s light and easy to operate and, I\'ll admit, lots of fun. It cycles through its rainbow of colours effectively and I like that you can stop it at a particular colour. As for claims that it emits a warm light -- this is absolutely not the case. The 3 levels of white lighting is by no means warm. It is a very cool light, veering towards the blue range of the colour spectrum rather than the red. That said, what I have done is allow the colour function to cycle and I stop it at the pale beigey/yellow spot. This provides the warm glow that I was hoping for. As for the 3 levels of white, they are all pretty bright. Again, I was hoping that the lowest level would be around the brightness of a 40-watt incandescent bulb maybe even a 25-watt. I\'d say that it is at least 60-watt strength with the next level being close to 100-watt. This (second) level is perfectly easy to read by. I find that the 3rd level is brighter than I would ever use. All-in-all, it\'s worth the money, providing an attractive lighting source and a great conversation piece.'
title: 'A fun lamp to put in a dark corner'

content: 'I do love this lamp. Easy to use, provides great lighting with a lot of variety in terms of brightness and full spectrum color.'My one knock is that it takes too long to cycle through to, say, purple. Maybe there\'s a quicker way but I haven\'t found it. Mostly I use the kind of amber/yellow right after the initial red so that\'s fast, but when I do want blue or purple it\'s slow to get to. I SO wish it had a remote to start off the sequence on the color spectrum I desired. Otherwise it\'s fantastic.'
title: 'bSmall design flaw. Doesn't ruin what is otherwise a great lamp!

content: 'bI have now purchased 1xWhite Light, 2xColour Lights and 1x rechargeable colour light from Aukey. I purchased the first for my Mother (87) who uses it as a night light by her bedside. Finally I bought the 4th (colour) for my Mom's 88th birthday this month for use as an accent in the living room. These are high quality construction and LED components. The packaging guarantees that it arrives from Amazon intact. Bright white light at 3 light levels. The colours are crisp and provide excellent accent lighting in any room. The smaller rechargeable colour lights for 24 hours continuously before requiring USB recharge. Ideal for use next to your computer.
title: 'High quality, 3-way white and variable colour LED lighting'

I think it's a defective item that Amazon was trying to get rid off. Don't buy from Amazon warehouse because you won't save anything (It looks cheaper, but when you add the TAX in, it will be the same as buying straight from the supplier), plus you will have warranty from them as well (NO WARRANTY on AMAZON WAREHOUSE's products)

content: 'I love this lamp. I bought it specifically for making puzzles and I couldn\'t be happier! The lamp has both the options to have a warm light as well as a cool light so it\'s perfect for what ever you want it for. The swivel arm and head are also great for getting light exactly where you want it. Another great function is the brightness can also change so you can truly customize exactly how much light you need. Now all of these functions are great bit there is one last really great touch. It also has a USB port so you can charge your phone or listen to music. I just love it!'
title: 'Brilliant table lamp!'

content: 'bI use it on a computer desk between two monitors, I can fold it down when I don't need, fold it up when I do need it. The head is thin so even when it's up at eye level, it's like it's not there. It's a solid build, many lighting options and even though I felt the USB charging port was I bit unnecessary, I find myself using it often. I'm very to have found this lamp, fills my need perfectly.
title: 'Stylish and practical'

content: 'bFell in love with the lamp right out of the box. Great looking. Love the controls and the many selections of light brightness and color! One really nice feature is the swiveling head, brilliant idea! You won't be disappointed!
title: 'Fantastic product and highly recommend!'

content: 'bOverall a pretty good lamp. I ordered two and one arrived broken, which was unfortunate. However I managed to fix it with some Gorilla glue because with a new baby around I really don't have time to bother with returns.Touch sensitivity, brightness, and size is great for smaller night stands and rooms.'bI really wish that the on/off button was independent from the colour selection. For example at night I like to use the dim light, but to turn the lamp off I need to tap through the brightest two settings to do so. If I want to select a colour like red I have to wait and cycle through the other colours. Then once it's off, I have to find it again. Let's say you always prefer the red colour when you turn it on, you'll have to do this every time. It's pretty annoying.Why four stars?'bI was disappointed by the white hue of the light even though the picture looks more yellow and it is advertised as such. I mean it's sort of warm, but nothing like the picture.bAlso, the bulb is not replaceable, so when it's done it will be done. LEDs are supposed to last a long time so we'll see if this is ever a problem.bIt's worth noting that the light has a small light on the bottom part, but it's not noticeable enough to actually keep you awake as other reviewers have stated.UPDATE: Lowered to 2 stars. Both lamps died after a year within days of each other. Aukey warranty service replacement is amazing, but the product itself is clearly not of quality.'
title: 'Overall a Good Little Lamp'

content: 'This is a really fun thing to have. I purchased it to use it as a reading lamp because I like the ability to change brightness settings. The touch response interface is really convenient and the RGB mode is great fun! I would definitely recommend this as a gift.'In a perfect world you would have greater control over the colour of the light (i.e., how warm it looks) in its regular mode. I would like to be able to have more yellow light before bed. I would also like to have greater control of the brightness of the light. Sometimes I wish I had a fourth setting between the least and middle most brightness.'
title: 'Nice addition to any room'

content: 'bThis has been my bedside lamp for over six months and I am rather satisfied with my purchase. My past experiences with AUKEY products haven't been so great so I was a little hesitant to purchase this lamp, but after extensive use I am happy. It gets really bright, has a variety of dimmable modes, and a timer function which is excellent for setting up at night, based on my sleeping patterns. Wish it had a switch on the actual lamp itself making it easier to turn on when it is pitch black in my room.
title: 'Satisfied but still missing something'

content: 'This light is amazing! I waited a while to buy it as the price had gone up within the day of me adding it to my basket. Finally went down and ordered right away. Super happy with the light. User has full control over how bright or how dim and what color you want. If you are doing something like fixing a watch or something detailed you can use the cool white at the brightest setting. If you just want to read or work on your computer then the warm white is great. I love the color change function; great for two people who have different prefernces for light. The timer feature only allows one hour, but I never knew what the timer is for in the first place.'bThe lamp itself is very nice and sleek. Came packaged very snug and safe. It's not obtrusive on your desk. You can fold it away when it isnt needed. Super simple to setup, and figure out. Comes with a warranty card, you have to register it online.Overall great purchase for a basic lamp with not so basic features.'
title: 'Great choice! Buy it on sale'

content: 'The functions of the lamp are great, but the real issue is the power button is unreliable. It is literally a struggle, sometimes up to several minutes to get the lamp to turn on or off. Perhaps ours was just a lemon. All the other touch buttons function other than the most important one: the power button. Sometimes we can get it to turn on or off by just tapping a million times, and sometimes it takes leaving our finger there for a minute or two. Super frustrating when you want to turn the lamp off to go to sleep.'Very surprising as I have bought other Aukey products in the past and they work flawlessly and are great value for money.'bOur lamp has become a bit of a paperweight at this point. It's a gamble to turn the lamp on, because if we do manage to get it on, it's likely to be a struggle to turn it off.
title: 'Great lamp, if you can get it to turn on or off.'

content: 'bI can't recommend this product. It randomly turns itself on into RGB alternating mode. It'll do that when it's off, or when it's on the regular lighting mode.bI really wanted to like this product, because when it works it is great. The 3 light settings are great, the RGB colours are nice, aesthetically it looks sleek. However, it's just not acceptable to have a light that automatically decides to turn itself on, or switches itself into RGB mode. And it won't turn off, so if you were out of the house.. yes it would stay on RBG until you turn it off manually.bAlso, since it is touch activated, sometimes when you're trying to just tap between the different light brightness settings, it'll register it as a long press which again, turns on RGB mode.

content: 'A really great product. Feels good, has a solid metal base and thick plastic on top. The light is super bright and comes with 3 modes, which go from very dim to very bright, the middle one being perfect IMO. The colour changing is nice, but not something I will ever use.'bThe only thing stopping me from giving 5 stars is the cord placement. It plugs into the right of the AUKEY logo, not to the back of the lamp, meaning you either have to turn the lamp 90 degrees to have it come out of the back or face the logo forwards but have the cord coming out of the side. Other than that little annoyance, it is perfect. Offers a really nice glow and stays cool to the touch. The touch sensitivity is also very sensitive, so you can just touch it lightly and it'll change mode. It is as simple as touching it to change the brightness of the white light and holding it down to change to coloured mode.
title: 'Great product, well made, bad power plug placement.'

content: 'The subject sums it up pretty well.'bThe lamp was for my children's room, it stopped working properly after less than two months and would randomly come on overnight and start changing colour - waking my kids up.I reached out on April 8th for a warranty replacement and as of today (May 29th), I still do not have a replacement. I have sent multiple emails and they claim they are going to honour the 24 month warranty, but I will believe it when I see it.'At this stage, I would prefer my money refunded and they can keep their lamp. If you like wasting your time dealing with a company that does not value customer service than this is the lamp for you. Otherwise, find another lamp from another company.'I am very disappointed.'
title: 'Stopped Working After Two Months and AUKEY Customer Service Is Horrible'

content: 'bThis lap has been a real lifesaver while I've been at school. The timer function is a really great tool to use when you're trying to not spend too much time on a task and a great alternative to setting a timer as a timer can make you lose your concentration when writing. The lamps ability to change its level of brightness has been a really amazing function on days where you need to see certain items in a clear light. The different types of lighting is also amazing and it really helps with ones eyesight on sleepless days due to assignments being due on the same day as well as studying for midterms. The nightlight function has also been helpful to use. The night light function is not too bright but, it gives a quick outline of where your desk is so you don't walk into it and wake up your roommate and disrupt their sleep.
title: 'Best Student Lamp!'

content: '**Moneybait**'bFirst of all, I'm not the kind who always complain; but I take time to write my first review because I think for the first time Amazon has tricked me (I cant believe the almost unanimous 5-star voting for this one; there's something wrong). Since I work in an office, I've seen what a GOOD led desk lamp looks and *feels* like, and this one is highly overpraised:- very cheap plastic for the price; it looks like it could break anytime'b- dust/fingerprint collector which is annoying since the material is a lot shiny; there's no way around this unless you put matte stickers all over itb- **second worst thing** No rotation for the top branch! Since the lamp is high on foot (too much for desktop work since you can't rotate the upper branch), its easy to get blinded if you move your head on the side or 'too low'.Since its direct light, you get glares on the stuff you are reading/working on which is *extremely* annoying even at lower brightness settings; a possibility for rotation would have help but who knows.. it must costs billions to integrate such a contraption I guess.'b- ***worst thing of all*** the lighting is awful imo.. it has as someone said a greenish/drab feel to it, which doesn't help concentration at all contrary to what they claim. The best option (and only for me) is the 'Night Mode', even for reading and working on stuff, **but the direct lighting focus make a spot instead of diffusing light uniformly.**b- and if your intention was to use it as a general lamp, you can forget it too which is not its purpose; maybe if you could rotate it could be used pointing at a wall for diffuse light, but you don't get much option with that moneybait..bI would pay 30$(can) *max* for this, and even at this price I wouldn't buy it. And good luck returning it; you will pay 1/4 of the price you paid in post fees (weight etc.)
title: 'bI've seen what a GOOD led desk lamp looks and *feels* like

content: 'bFor the money you pay you're really getting a quality product. The brightness adjustment is very convenient. The lamp has a nice sleek look to it and the fact that you can adjust its position in different directions is extremely helpful. For instance, when I draw I like to bring the light quite close to my sketch book, whereas when I study I prefer it further away with a dimmer brightness setting. I also like how the bulbs are positioned, it makes the light more dispersed so it lights a larger surface area. It is also worth noting that the bulbs don't get hot. Overall it's an awesome product, I don't think you could find something like this for that price at the store.
title: 'Awesome!'

content: 'It s a good lamp. The feature to pick the type of light is a very good one. It s nice that you can vary the light from brilliant hard white light to a softer warmer yellow light. Plus you can set intensity. The only down side is the base is made of a softer material and it appears it can be marked by objects rubbing against it like keys or tv remote. It s not like a scratch but it leaves a visible mark that doesn t rub off. It would be better if the base was more resistant. But overal I like the light a lot.'

content: 'bYou would never think how much a simple lamp could impact your life. I was always used to a simple bed side lamp, and after using this product i dont think i can ever go back to one. where should i start, the style, the low energy LED, the different light modes, the timer, the foldability, usb charging port. All things that i never thought about that could make a lamp sooo much more useful. the only issue i have with it, is that the base could be a bit more weighted, to keep it more planted while adjusting the lamp. All i have to say is, that is you have a plain old lamp, buy this and you'll wonder why arn't all lamps like it.
title: 'wow'

content: 'i got this to replace a swing arm lamp on my desk. i had gone through several and even up to $50 models i found that they were poorly constrcted and often broke. on some the springs were held by plastic pegs that break, on others the metal post that holds the lamp wasnt strong enough to support the weight of the lamp. while looking for a replacement that wouldnt break and didnt cost $100 i came across this. This item is far better than any of the swing arm desk lamps ive had before. the arm is adjustable, stays in place easily. there are many light warmth settings, so you can have it bright for doing paperwork, or put in on a soft light for watching TV or falling asleep. each of the light warmth settings has adjustable brightness as well, it has a 60 minute off timer. i also love and make great use of the USB port on the base for charging devices. The base is large, sturdy and well weighted so the lamp doesnt tip or move. the base also has a slight concave spot on it too so you could hold little screws or something without them rolling away.'This is the best desk lamp ive used, the next best would be a standard swing arm desk lamp that attaches via clamp that was all metal and lasted forever, through all kinds of abuse. i didnt realize how good i had it until i needed to replace it. If i had to complain about this lamp i would say that the base does take up valuable desk real estate, where most swing arm lamps would just clamp to the edge of the desk, but i just put the item plugged into the USB port on it, so its not completely wasted space, as well at $38 its a small price to pay for such a classy looking, functional and bright lamp.'
title: 'best lamp ive used. great price. definately recommend or buy again if i need a lamp.'

content: 'bI got this lamp during a lightning deal, normally it's $70 something, but I paid about $50. I can't imagine paying full price for this, because I feel like it's not even worth the price I paid. The good - it's sturdy, the clip does a good job at holding the lamp in place on my desk, the light is fairly bright, but not bright enough to light up a room. The light is good enough to light up your desk area but that's it. Now for the bad - the controls. There's no dials, no buttons, just a touch sensitive rectangle near the base of the lamp. Tap the bottom of the rectangle and it turns on. Tap the top and it'll cycle through the built in modes. Tap and hold the top to change colour temperature, or tap and hold the bottom to change brightness. The thing I hate most about the controls is that you can't just turn it up or down a little bit. If the light is halfway between max and min brightness, and I want to dim the light a bit more, I have to tap and hold until it reaches maximum brightness, then tap and hold again for it to dim the light. Same with colour temperature. Want the light a little bit more blue? You have to tap and hold until it reaches maximum yellow light, then tap and hold again for it to change to blue. Also it's nearly impossible to see where the controls are in the dark. I really feel like this lamp is worth no more than $25.b**UPDATE** I've had this lamp for about 10 months now and I can no longer dim the light. When I try to dim the light, it emits a horrible ringing noise at a brain-piercing pitch. It's truly horrible. I'm looking for a replacement now so I can finally throw this thing in the garbage.
title: 'Not bad, controls are annoying though'

content: 'bIt's perfect for adding an extra bit of light over a desk as long as you already have lots. The switch is close to impossible to find unless you have light to locate it. It's sort of a circular problem. You need light to find the switch but to get the light you have to find the switch. Turning it off is another problem. It has a delay so you don 't know if you have touched the right place. When the light doesn't go off you naturally touch it again and that just stops the off process so it stays on so you touch it again to turn it off but when it doesn't go off ... In short, only useful in very limited places. I wouldn't buy it again (or anything like it.)

content: 'bI just bought this lamp, after asking the community if it was bright enough to read by. A ton of people responded (thank you!) and every one said that it was indeed bright enough. I ordered it right away and it arrived quickly and the reviews were correct: it is (I'm going to sound like a teenager here lol) awesome. I wish the colour rotation aspect of the lamp had been around when I was little! I would have loved it. The only thing I wanted to say is that (I have it thisclose to my bed) even when off, unless you unplug it, it gives off a sort of soft blue glow in the dark. This doesn't bother me at all but I suppose it might bother someone who likes complete and total darkness at night. The reason I bought this lamp is because I had a large, rather unwieldy lamp there before that took up most of my bedside table and was hard to turn on and off. This lamp is so unassuming and comparably small that I can't believe how much space it has cleared up. Thank you very much!

title: 'Simple and generous'

content: 'June 4, 2019'bThe seller's customer service was fantastic. They go above and beyond to figure out the problem I was having. And they refunded me and took responsibility of the defects of the product. The product is great in theory - it is a brilliant idea, and visually was executed beautifully. There just seems to be some defects in the ones I got. I theorize that it is just a simple defect in the engineering of the product. Hope all goes well with future products.I will update this to a 3/5 rating because of how great the customer service was. They definitely believe in their product and are confident that this was a rare issue.'*End of updates*'June 3, 2019'I contacted the seller. They are really nice and helpful. I advised them of the defects of my product. They indicated that they are willing to send a replacement. They requested me to upload a video of the defects to their upload site. I thought this was a great idea because it shows that they really care about their product, and want to actually know whats wrong with it. And it also shows that they are confident in their product due to the fact that they want to make sure people are not lying to them. I uploaded the video successfully and they agreed that it was defective. They then sent me a replacement model.'I received the replacement today and although it performed slightly better than the first one I got, it still had similar defects on the top panel. Lets face it, I didn\'t buy this product solely to be used as a lamp. The speaker and control feature of this product was something I really wanted to use. And for this price, it should work flawlessly! The new issues are as follows: When connecting to bluetooth and playing music, the - button does not go to the previous track as it is supposed to do. In the video I had sent them you can see me hold down the - button and even tap it multiple times, and all it does is reduce the volume. It does not go to the previous track. Further, in the video they can see see that the +\' button increases the volume when I tap it and when I hold it down. Sometimes, even when I simply tap the + button it goes to the next song instead of increasing the volume. And when I just want to go to the next song without increasing the volume by tapping the + button, the volume will increase while going to the next song. So imagine it was night time, and I was using the product before bed and listening to music. Say I wanted to go to the next song at a low volume/whatever it is at, if I hold down + the volume would drastically increase while going to the next song, deeming the product defective and not performing to its intended purpose. In the video they can also see me holding down the + to go to the next song but all it is doing is increasing the volume.'Seeing that they are confident in their product. I personally think the batch that is at the amazon warehouse is defective or treated poorly. Even though it is an expensive product, it is a cheap quality. So if in the warehouse they are being moved around without care, this could cause some damages like this. I will update accordingly if need be. But I am still firm on my stance of do not buy.'May 30, 2019'DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT FOR THIS PRICE - DEFECTIVE PRODUCT - RIP OFF'bThe lamp came in today but seems to not work. The volume panel is not working and the fader for the light is not seamless. Seems to be a slight delay/lag in tracking up and down the touch pad. For this price, I would not expect these defects. I can't even imagine what their margins are. I feel ripped off. They market this product as high end and premium quality, but it does not seem to be the case.I will change this review once an adequate solution is provided. I have contacted Amazon who has contacted the seller. I have emailed the seller and have messaged them through the messaging feature on Amazon. I want a replacement that is guaranteed to work. Will update once I get more information on a solution.'
title: 'Great Customer, I just had a really defective product (bad batch) - likely rare experience'

Unlike several other desk lamps available, the actual lighting bar is longer than most of its peers (meaning greater lit area). Keep this in mind when comparing lower priced models even if rated well for lighting and features.'Aukey customer service was excellent making this in my view a recommended pick.'

content: 'bThis lamp is amazing. I'm thinking now why aren't all lamps built like this? It has three settings for brightness - Relax, Study and Reading. Each level offers a different type of light. Then these levels can be adjusted to plus or minus the intensity for more or less light for each setting.bThe lamp is made from black glossy plastic in a simple, sleek design. The LED bulb doesn't create heat which is a huge plus for me. The bulb isn't replaceable but from reading the answers section it's rated to last for almost 20 years. The unit comes with a 1 year warranty.I love the On/Off button which works with just the slightest touch of your finger - no struggling with toggles and when off there\'s a tiny red light to show where the button is. The light goes across horizontally and you can push the arm forward to have the light more across your work. The lamp bar can be lowered as well. The light doesn\'t shine in your eyes, the lap top screen or the tv. I run a fan in summer on my desk and the slim profile of the lamp doesn\'t block the flow at all. The base is about 6 1/2 square and has a low profile. The base isn\'t super heavy but is heavy enough to keep the lamp from moving and there\'s rubber on the base.'bThere's a USB port to charge the cell phone as well. I don't think I'll ever buy a different type of desk lamp again. This lamp meets all my needs for a desk lamp..
title: 'Love the controls for brightness and sleek style'

content: 'The lamp is well constructed and the finishing (which is glossy) appears durable. The base is solid and hefty, though some may consider it excessively large.'As far as the LEDs go, brightness is better than expected (and the figures touted by other reviews are accurate- output is around 500-550 lumens) and the ability to operate different modes is excellent- reading activates both the yellow and white LEDs, while study mode activates white LEDs only. This allows for a great level of flexibility and in my opinion can replace the role of SAD lights as the wavelength emitted is broadly in the same spectrum.'Another thing to note is that the on/off buttons remain illuminated once plugged in so there is a small passive draw on the outlet, and that the power adapter is rated for 110 to 240V, so if one were to relocate there would be no issues with compatibility.'bOverall, for $60 I'm very impressed. The brightness would be less than say, a florescent tube lamp of the same price, but the low power draw and heat of LEDs, the ability to charge one USB port (ipad mini compatible) and multiple light settings offset these negatives. I would wholeheartedly recommend this product if not for the fact that there is no diffuser and hence glare may be an issue. The oxyled smart may be the more prudent choice if that is your concern.
title: 'Great lamp for $60'

One good thing is they include a polishing cloth which is very soft. The ANKER lamp had a major problem with the base that was very easily scratched. I hope the plastic of the TaoTronics is more resistant. The prices is good, but that was not the reason to buy it. I wanted something with a certain level of quality since the lamp is supposed to last years. For the moment, I will give 4 stars and see later if it can get a five. The study light is the one I use the most, but the reading one is bright and doesn't hurt my eyes at all, and the sleep and relax lighting are just as great to keep on. content: 'bWorks great, touch is sensitive, brightness levels are perfect for child's room from night light to reading light. mood lighting is more useful for adults then kids but hard to get out of their room now since they like the night light. Sturdy construction and no electronic hum. only dislike is the placement of the power cord connection if you like the led on the light facing forward the plug comes out of the side instead of the back. If you are not Sheldon this is not a deal breaker, if the plug came out the back I would have given 5 stars. You can see in the picture what I mean about the cord. If placed on left hand night table it wouldn't be a problem
title: 'Love it'

content: 'EDIT'bI had issues with the original lamp (see ORIGINAL REVIEW) but I'm updating the review to reflect the fact that AUKEY has one of the best customer support I know. After my review, they contacted me and sent me another lamp, I didn't had to do anything. The new lamp works perfectly (from the prints bellow the lamp it seems is a newer revision of the hardware). So, I had bad luck with the first lamp but I'm glad to know that the company really cares about their customers. The new lamp quality seems excelent. And because of the great customer support I can easily recomend Aukey products and this lamp is really nice.ORIGINAL REVIEW'bThe lamp works great, when it works. The problem is that it started to fail after a week or something, only the color mode was working and the white light stopped working. The external product quality is quite good, besides the power brick which does not inspire confidence. Because I didn't wanted to spend all the time that it requires to return a product I disassembled the lamp and found that the ribbon data/power cable that communicates a little motherboard with the led lighting was not correctly connected at one of the ends (the end that requiring a full disassemble :( ). Obviously, they didn't checked the quality of the assembly because it was pretty obvious, even a latch was broken.bIt's a shame, because the quality of the individual components looks and feels quite good (besides the power brick which seems cheap) but the assembly of my particular unit was awful.At the end of the day, it seems like a generic kind of cheap made in china lamp which was rebranded. So I guess you are better buying cheaper options.'Pros:'- Nice lightning'- Work as described (if your lamp is luckily well assembled)'- Good parts quality'Cons:'- Bad assembly quality'- Bad quality control'- Cheap power brick'- It cannot be turned on with a wall light switch'
title: 'Great Customer Support'

content: 'bThis lamp is good for the price, but next time I'll probably save for something better. As advertised, this lamp does both white light and RGB. The white light mode has 3 options that you can cycle through by quickly touching the base of the lamp. To activate RGB mode, you have to long press the base. This will start a cycle through all colours. You can tap the base again to stop the cycle at a desired colour. This works well, but I am left wishing for more complex colour selection options that I have seen on smart light bulbs and more expensive lamps with phone apps.TL:DR - Great RGB starter lamp, but if you can, save for the more expensive stuff.'
title: 'Good, Cheap RGB Lamp'

content: 'bI was looking for something to replace my old lamp, and I wanted something sleek and modern that wouldn't take up a lot of space. This lamp fit the bill. It has three brightness settings, which you can iterate through by simply touching the base. The first tap will have the lowest brightness which is great for night time reading, then there's a medium and a higher brightness. The highest brightness is enough to light up my room, which is fairly large. To turn off the lamp you would have to tap through the second and third brightness, which some people might find annoying but it's really not big deal.bMy only problem with the lamp is that the RGB is not really smooth, I don't know if it's my lamp in particular or if it's a problem with all of them but for instance going from red to orange there's a noticeable sudden change rather than a gradual one. I don't use the RGB much so it's not the end of the world, and even when I use it it's basically noticeable if you're really paying attention and staring at the lamp.Another minor thing was that the white part has a seem running vertically? I wish it was smooth all around, especially because the seem on mine is not perfectly straight/smooth, which bothered me at first but again is not really noticeable unless really looking so I just ignored it.'bOther than that, I've had it for some time now and it works great and does the job.
title: 'Great bedside lamp.'

content: 'This is generally a well-designed product. But it misses in a few key areas:'1. The biggest issue--as with most LED lighting products--is the harsh quality of the light. The blue-white colour on the 2 reading modes will trouble anyone (like myself) with the slightest light sensitivity. The 3rd mode, relax, mostly solves the problem by shifting the light colour into the warm part of the colour spectrum. However, the brightness suffers as a result and there should be more light output to overcome this. This is the setting that most people will find comfortable, I believe, for all their tasks...and it is just not bright enough.'2. Kudos to the heavily-weighted base which makes the unit difficult to overturn. However, the rest of the lamp is all plastic--and very lightweight plastic at that. It does not inspire confidence in the longevity of the lamp, especially the potential for breakage if overturned or over-manipulated. At this price point, a bit more metal or rugged plastic construction would seem warranted.'
title: 'Good, but Not Great'

content: 'bIn terms of actual function, it is great. Easy setup, controls are easy to use and work great. Quality is pretty good, although personally I would prefer matte black plastic over glossy black, that's a personal preference. Brightness levels are good, it gets very bright, in fact I actually wish it was able to be dimmed even further, but not too bad. I'm used to a very warm colored light, so the virtually white light on this is something I'll have to get used to. Even sleep mode is quite white, my only complaint is that it doesn't have a warmer light for the sleep mode. It's much better than the study mode, but still lacking.
title: 'Great product, light temperature is quite cool however.'

content: 'bI didn't know I needed so many freaking settings for my desk lamp but here we are lol. This is a solid product! Comes with a heavy base that holds the light firmly in place. The light can be folded down and swiveled. The light cannot be rotated at the top however, just folded at the corner at the top and the bottom and then swiveled at the base. Something I didn't notice until I got this thing out at home was that there is a USB port for charging the phone! A little bonus for me, I have my phone there at the base leaned up on it so I can see calls coming in when I have a headset on playing my vidya games.Oh right and the settings! The four major settings are all very distinct and effective for what they are labeled as and as well they can all be brightened or dimmed to 4 different levels totaling I guess '8' settings. Solid product here boys, highly recommend.
title: 'Heavy solid base, high customizability with many settings, USB port for charging phone, settings to go very bright or very dim.'

content: 'bThis is a great lamp for a student, or anyone who likes to read in bed. I'm sure you've already read the product descriptions, but here's the rub: there's a wide range of light and colour warmth settings, making it excellent if you're sensitive to light before bed; the USB port is also great for charging a phone. If you like a minimalist setup next to your bed, this lamp will do it for you. The one critique that I have is that the lamp doesn't feel super sturdy. Other reviewers have pointed out that the plastic feels a bit flimsy when moved around: I agree. I would recommend that if you intend to move the lamp (at all!) that you minimize shear forces by holding another part of the lamp. (eg., if you want to move the head, hold the shaft; if you want to move the shaft, hold the base.)
title: 'Great lamp for a great price'

content: 'I needed a new lamp for my night stand and this one fit the bill. It is gloss black which is nice as it goes with my phone and clock radio. Shipping was super fast and the lamp was easy to set up. There were other lamps that appeared identical but had a different company logo on them so I think the lamp may be generic and each company can put their name on it. I purchased the Taotronics as it was 30$ less expensive than the others that appeared the same on this site. I was a bit worried that the brightest setting would not have enough brightness that I need. But I did not find that a problem. The lamp has 4 different settings(sleep, relax, study, reading) and a port to charge your phone. there is also an adjustment for light intensity level at each setting. Overall I am happy with my purchase. Hopefully, it will last a long time.'
title: 'futuristic table lamp'

content: 'bA nice light that is bright enough for a desk light. It can be positioned in many ways to allow for illumination of different objects (i.e., can position it for reading a book, for illuminating the room, etc.). The only thing I don't like about the light is that it is a bit flimsy; it is almost entirely made of plastic so it feels a bit cheap (but this does not compromise its functionality). Also, when adjusting the light, I sometimes need to hold the base to prevent it from tipping over. But overall, a very nice light with a useful design.
title: 'Nice light with useful features'

content: 'bI thought this would light up the entire little room I bought it for like a regular table lamp does. It's definitely a task light -- doesn't light up the entire room but provides excellent lighting for working at desk/table (better than any other desk lamp I've tried). Doesn't work for weaving on the upper half of my tabletop tapestry loom -- I can raise the light bar part high enough but that bothers my eyes, light shines directly into them when I do (can't position the light in front of the weaving, would be in my way). Weaving aside, it's a terrific task light, bright enough for working with tiny pieces and more than sufficient for reading/writing/study. Chose standard (free) shipping -- ordered on a Friday night, arrived here (Ontario) the following Monday morning which was a bonus. Like that it has a built-in charger + a timer, is so easy to turn on and off (just a light touch of a finger req'd).
title: 'Excellent Task Light'

content: 'Great desk lamp. Materials feel admittedly a little flimsy, but all joints have remained solid (update: still kicking strong 6+ months later) and the design keeps all parts out of the way from accidental bumps. I personally caught it on sale at a great deal, but I would say it\'s a solid investment. And since many Amazon ads are plagued by incentivized reviews, I should clarify I paid full (sale) price -- no discounts or bonuses in exchange for this, or any, of my reviews.'
title: 'Great desk lamp'

content: 'This lamp is good for working and reading. Good settings to very light colour and brightness. The height is 18 inches /46 cm. When sitting at desk the light is high enough not to bother eyes, when shifting around or talking across a desk.'Rotates on base and lamp lifts vertical for lots of options.'Works great for me.'
title: 'Quick delivery and good quality'

content: 'bI have only had this unit for a day, but so far I'm lovin' it.Assembly takes about a minute.'It has five pre-set levels that not only change the brightness, but also the colour of the light. So, you can have it look yellow-ish like older incandescent bulbs, or blueish like some florescent lights, or very bright white, or a very dim, soft yellow for sleeping or just before bed.'bEach pre-set can have its brightness adjusted by pressing the arrow buttons. There is just no way you will find this doesn't give you brightness and type of light you are looking for.The buttons are all touch sensitive, and work flawlessly.'bThe base has some weight to it so it won't get tipped over easily.Unit comes with a 2-year warranty, which is nice even though it would have to be shipped away for service if it does go bad.'The power comes from an ac adapter (a wall-wart). The stem has a USB port for charging, but since my phone charger sits on my end table, I doubt I will ever use it. Still nice to have in a pinch though.'Very happy with this purchase.'
title: 'Very nice lamp. Perfect if it lasts.'

content: 'bThis is a great table lamp and bedside lamp. This lamp is definitely worth the price!'bOnly thing I'd have liked was a longer cord. It was larger than I expected, but the flat base makes it essentially take up no additional space as you can rest things on the surface of the base
title: '10/10 bedside and desk lamp'

content: 'bReally pleased with this lamp - it is lightweight and sleek, a great lamp for a small workspace. The tone of the light is very pleasant - white not yellow with three different levels of brightness. The USB port on the side is super handy. I haven't tested the timer function or the sleep mode yet. All in all, i feel that this was a good buy.
title: 'Sleek and functional'

content: 'bThis is, in my opinion and after testing many desk lights, one of the best I've used. To put it simply, the feature set, design considerations, good styling, and versatility make this lamp a worthwhile consideration if you are looking to buy a new desk lamp/bed light/general reading light.Feature set: With plenty of both blue- and incandescent-tinted LEDs, this is lamp is able to provide 4 lighting modes: sleep, relax, study, and read. In each mode, the intensity of the light can be adjusted in 5 steps, going from rather dusk-like dimness in the sleep mode to full-on bright reading intensity in study mode. Each mode uses a specific combination of the 2 types of LED lights and produces different temperatures that really do work for the suggested proposes: the study mode is great for students like me, as it keeps you up and awake almost like a strong cup of coffee!'Along with the lighting modes, there is a sleep timer for 60 mins that also works like a charm. The lighting selection pad is touch-sensitive, and I have never had issues with it. Not only is it super sensitive unlike those cheap touch pads on other electronics, the use of dim, red LED lights in the touch pad to illuminate the different modes and power buttons is nice. When the lamp is off, the power button is not only lit red to easily find in the darkness, it doesn\'t disturb you when the room is pitch-dark!'bDesign: What can I say? It's the nicest looking lamp I have seen! It's sleek, glossy, with a stable base. You can't accidentally knock over the lamp in normal use, and all the hinges seem strong and durable. The coolest thing about LEDs is that they produce a very nice, non-fatiguing light unlike other bulb-based designs, and so you will eventually come to appreciate the technology here.The lamp also swivels around its base 360 degrees, but the power cord (which is detachable) prevents it from swivelling all the way around (not that you expected it to, anyway).'Overall, this is a great product. As long as it holds up to daily use, which shouldn\'t cause too much strain, I can see this being my primary desk lamp for years to come. So long to those architect lamps that I held so dear to myself: these lamps are far superior in every way, providing the same lighting with the added benefits of design, styling, and thoughtful features.'
title: 'The Mighty, Stylish Elune'

content: 'This is a very sleek, foldable, and portable desk lamp. There are no raised buttons and a glossy finish, so it is very easy to wipe down. The arm AND light head itself swivels and the arm is fully foldable. You can change the warmth setting too. content: 'I bought this lamp after reading recommendations on Reddit\'s Buy It For Life forum, and reading some personal reviews here.'bThe fit and finish are very good--It's made of light plastic, but the joints are solid and it stays in the position you want.The light and controls are awesome too. I thought having four light temperatures (white to yellow) plus brightness adjust would be over the top, but after having the lamp around for a while it just feels like all lights should have that function.'bThe touch controls are pretty responsive. They miss a touch maybe 5% of the time, so I'm pretty happy with it.bIt's just a really nice lamp. I never thought I'd be this excited about a lamp. o_OOh, bonus; the customer service team actually e-mailed me after a couple of weeks to check in and make sure everything was working well. TaoTronics are pretty serious about making a name for themselves.'
title: 'bI've never been excited about a lamp before. This thing is really nice.

content: 'First thing to note is that the packaging is done very well. A true retail piece, not some brown boxed affair. The light itself is even covered in protective film to protect against marks, and also comes with a cloth wipe to clean it. And a clear and concise manual in English, German and French.'bGreat size; I was afraid it would be too small, but after reading some other reviews of people saying it was bigger than they expect, and reading the dimensions, it's exactly what I wanted in a desk lamp. The range of brightness and warmth are great. I tend to favor the lower temperatures, but it goes from the soft yellow/white to clinical blue/white at the touch of a button.bNot my first TaoTronics piece, but this is the one that will give me confidence to buy some of their other products with ease. With the amount of knockoffs and cheaply made pieces available now, that's huge for me.

content: 'bWhat can i say, the item is a near perfect desk lamp. I almost bought another variation of this where the lamp head did not swivel, this one does which is a must have for me. Construction is great but my only complaints are, now I'm being extremely critical here; is that the plastic arm feels a bit too light and plasticky along with the finish LOVES finger prints. It does come with a cloth but id rather not have to wipe it down every time i touch it. The lamp is EXTREMELY sturdy for being plastic, the base is perfect for this product. I have also yet to see the arms droop down on their own, the hinges are tight yet very manageable. The different types of lights are amazing and the USB charge port is nice touch. Quite surprised on how this lamp doesnt get as hot as some other lamps ive used.bOver all, it's a fantastic product. Thinking about placing a few of these around the house.

Brightness is more than enough for reading and I usually like to adjust it down a bit for the optimal reading brightness. I also found bedtime/relax mode is convenient at night when I just want to relax with my dogs before bedtime. Head not being adjustable is definitely a flaw to improve for future models, as some reviews have mentioned. 60-minute timer is useful although I wish there were different timer options. Overall, it's a great product for the price.
title: 'Highly Recommend'

content: 'I do not usually get excited over purchases such as lamps- however- when I received this lamp- and since I have begun using it, I have to say- I LOVE IT!!!'I use it as a light in my bedroom on my night table- and It has many different light settings as far as color/intensity/etc- which is very convenient....and you can even leave it folded when on- and it provides a nice night light ambiance.'bIt's very clean looking, and takes up very little room - which is another benefit.Also- with my other lamp- my cat used to jump up on the shade, etc, because it was warm. No problems here as there is no heat from the bulbs, and as I said- and you can fold it closed to use even less space.'What I love most- is i keep my iphone next to my bed- charging at night- and have tried every single cell phone holder- with suction cups on the bottom, and different bases, etc..and none of them kept stuck on the base.'With this lamp- there is an amazing rubbery feeling base- that holds the cell phone suction cup like cement!!! AND- right next to the very handy usb charger built into the lamp.'There is also a timer- which is handy in case you are used to falling asleep with the light on.'My only concern is where will I buy replacement bulbs when they die out (if they ever do?) :-)'I plan to order another one very soon- (unless the company that sells them- reads this amazing review- and decides to send me one for free!!) lol'GREAT LAMP!'
title: 'Awesome LIGHT!!!'

content: 'I bought this as a side light for in my bedroom so that I would have a good light to turn on if I need to get up in the night, or just to have something on to read under or surf the web before bed.'I really like this lamp. It has a heavy base so its doesnt slide around on my side table, it has many different options of light types and brightness which is nice to be able to change depending on what kind of light you need. I also really like the USB connectivity on the side as I use it to charge my phone at night allowing me to have a light and plug in my phone with only one outlet, leaving one open for other uses.'My only real complaints with regards to this lamp are its controls. The touch sensitive buttons are really cool and the fact that the power button glows when its off makes it really easy to find in the dark, but its a little too easy to turn on. I regularly accidentally activate or deactivate the light with my knuckle when i put my phone down on its base, brushing up against the button.'I also wish that the light could be turned on by selecting one of the different setting options. Sometimes I want to turn the light on with a dimmer setting at night or turn it on with a brighter setting during the evening and afternoon. Having to turn the lamp on first to change the setting it a bit tedious and can get annoying if you had it set really high or low previously and have to adjust it immediately after turning it on. Having the ability to turn the lamp on by present one of the presets would be an awesome addition to the next generation of these lights.'

content: 'I was a fan of the Anker Lumos A2 that I decided to try the TaoTronics Elune. Other reviews have covered lighting temperatures and I agree that both the lamps are fantastic and versatile. I have used this one in particular for building hobby kits. This review will not compare the Anker and the TaoTronics, but I will note that there are some similarities (the overall design and functionality) and also notable differences (the TT has a shorter lamp head so it folds down completely and the power cord jack is on the back.)'bThe main issue I have with this lamp is the build quality. As another reviewer has stated, it feels cheap. Tapping on the plastic and feeling the overall weight, it did not feel sturdy enough and I'm a bit concerned with the stiffness in the joints. Having the arm up and the head 90 degrees from it (like in the product image), I banged on the table a bit and the head began to dip a little.The base of the lamp is nice and heavy, however the one I received does not sit level with the desk. Pressing down on the corners of the base, the lamp wobbles as if there is a small space between the corners and the desk.'bOverall still a very nice lamp. The look and the size is very nice for any desk. It's just too bad the price doesn't really justify the overall quality of the lamp.
title: 'Great, bright lamp, but it feels a bit cheap.'

content: 'bI bought this lamp for my desk at first, but realized it would actually serve better as a nightstand lamp. I put it right next to my bed, and it works perfectly! Its adjustable head makes reading in bed so much easier. The lamp also folds up so it's really compact and looks pretty sleek!The lamp has two pivot joints as pictured in the product description. The top joint moves from around 0-170 degrees. The bottom one is -10-40 degrees roughly. It is also rotateable at the base.'bThe lamp has four lighting modes and 4-5 brightness levels. The lamp itself has a bank of cool white LEDs and warm orange-ish LEDs. Each of the four modes utilizes a different combination of orange/yellow. I find I use sleep mode (almost all orange) and reading mode (combo of white/orange) the most. Apart from the mode/brightness controls, there is also a power button and a 1h snooze button. Finally, the lamp comes with a USB port for USB charging (which I use for my phone when I'm sleeping).My only complaint is that the base is not heavy enough, so adjusting the lamp sometimes moves the base entirely.'Pros:'- Nice design'- USB charging port included'- Bright, multi-mode light'Cons:'- Base is too light'
title: 'Great lamp!'

content: 'bOverall a solid lamp. Works as advertised. I'm not sure the value is all there though, having unboxed it and set it up - I'm having trouble seeing a $80 lamp... around the $40-50 mark would be more appropriate IMO. The materials, while they look great, still feel cheap. The movement (to adjust) is floppy and loose. I also wish it was larger, maybe 1.3-1.5x the size. The advertised dimensions are accurate, but sitting on my desk - next to my monitors... I really wish it was bigger.bAll that said, its the best I've found so far. Looks great next to a small monitor, as long as you don't touch it or try to move it. If you do, you'll start wondering why it cost $80+
title: 'This is a great $50 lamp.'

content: '9 months into purchase, this review still stands plus one pro.'Pros:'-The look is very slick.'-Controls work very well.'-Light modes and intensities make it easy to customize your experience depending on activity. Plus it remembers the intensity level it was set at last time on each mode independently.'-USB port charges my phone. One less power converter using current when off.'-*NEW* The charging USB port has high power, it manages to feed enough power to my Nexus 5X for the fast charge mode. This is surprising since Google and reviewers claim only the stock charger can do so. There is an indicator on the phone saying it is charging rapidly, I doubt it is lying. Great feature.'Cons: (no deal breakers but still...)'-Although rotation and angles are well documented, i was disappointed that I did not notice it was not as flexible as my other, older, desk lamps.'-When off, the power button has a pretty bright red LED behind it. That is a nuisance if the lamp is in your bedroom. I covered it with electrical tape and the controls still work but that might not be cool for everyone.'-The rotating connection between the weight plate and the vertical arm is a bit wobbly, nothing major, but a bit annoying when you move the lamp.'b-The plastic looks awesome but doesn't feel sturdy. The lamp is extremely light so it probably doesn't matter at all but it's still how it feels.Overall, I paid ~55$. Great lamp for that price. Would have probably been REALLY disappointed if I had paid the original price of 129.99$'
title: '-Light modes and intensities make it easy to customize your experience depending on activity'

content: '1) This product was super easy to assemple, I believe only in 2 or 3 steps'2) The brightness levels and the control pad in general are very easy to operate'3) The swivel function and changing the light angle works great'b4) The look of the lamp is very nice and fits well on my desk (my desk isn't that big either)
