content: ' What a lamp. I\'m too used to having those cheapo lamps that only turn on and off. This is my first taste of the future, and I guess the future is now!'The touch interface is great to use. I guess no mechanical buttons to wear out on me. But do touch interfaces wear out too? Someone more experienced than me at this will need to answer.'Has a timer that\'s auto set to 1 hour, and you can\'t change it. Has 5 different colour temperature settings that range from a warm 3000k to a cool 5500k. Has a night light mode that turns on just the tip of the lamp. The slide brightness control isn\'t continuous. You basically go through 7 brightness settings. The slider is 7 touch buttons place side by side. So in reality, you don\'t really need to do a sliding motion. You just need to press the corresponding line segment on the slider, and it will jump to that brightness.'bThe lamp is also very flexible and you can adjust the 3 swivel points to suit your needs. I wouldn't adjust them too much, as it can get loose later on, though I think it can be adjusted, if you remove the screws which are covered by rubber nubs, and do a little maintenance yourself.
title: 'So many functions beyond your typical desk lamp'

content: 'SUMMARY'Great lamp with all the features that you could possibly want. Does get a bit hot after a while and needs a higher current USB outlet. Recommended'PACKAGING'The box is pretty plain without much wow factor, but it is clean and has the right amount of text. Packaging was a little banged up due to shipping, but the insulation was good enough to weather the shipping without damaging the lamp. Inside, you\'ll find the lamp (already connected to the base), a power plug, manual and warranty card (2 years). The lamp is protected by a bag and sticky film on all glossy surfaces.'LAMP CONSTRUCTION'The lamp is well thought out. The base is heavy enough to stay stable with any position of the lamp. The lamp head is collapsable for a nice stowaway position when not in use. The lamp head can swing out to what looks like 120 degrees and tilt its lights 90 degrees from its pointing down axis. The arm can swing from flat to 90 degrees upright, and about 40 degree pivot from the base. The power cord looks to be around 6 feet, allowing for easy hookup to a wall socket or power bar.'LAMP FEATURES'The lamp has a multitude of features:'- Timer: 60 minute shut off feature (not tested)'- Color temp cycle: 5 color modes (yellow to blue) See pics for color samples'- Night light: it is a low powered yellow light to show you where the lamp is in the dark. Note that the lamp does not detect light intensity and turn on the night light, you have to turn it on and off yourself.'- Light intensity setting: 7 different intensities. See pics for intensity levels'bAll work well. The color temps actually make a difference and you could change based on the ambient lighting. The intensities are dim and bright enough to get you what you want. With the lamp light being so long, the Aukey casts light over a large area. One note is that the lamp head gets noticeably hot after a while of operation at the highest intensity. I don't know if this will affect lifetime of the lamp.USB CHARGER'The usb port is supposed to output 1A. Hooked up to a Nexus 6P, it was outputing 661mA. Good enough to charge, but I would like a larger output (2A or so). See pic.'CONCLUSION'bBest LED lamp I've bought. Aukey has done it again with a great design and abundant features. I've recommended this lamp to others and they are equally as impresed as I am by the looks and performance. Just get a higher output on the USB port and I don't know how else you could improve on this.
title: 'Great lamp with all the features that you could possibly want'

content: 'This lamp has good features like:'- Lots of adjustability'- Minimalist design (imo)'- 5 light temperatures'- Night light feature'- Rubber feet on bottom of the base'Downsides:'- The joints where the lamp adjusts are not real tight, and as a result the lamp will wobble a bit if the desk moves a little bit.'- USB port is very limited on amperage. It charges my iPhone at a snail pace.'- Power supply is not UL listed'bOverall, I'd recommend this lamp to anyone looking for a good looking budget-conscious lamp with lots of adjustability and different temperature lighting.EDIT: Aukey reached out to me regarding some of my concerns and sent me a new unit which has remedied my biggest concerns. Their customer support was very easy to deal with and genuinely wanted to help. A+ here'
title: 'Good lamp for the money'

content: 'I read reviews and decided to buy this one. Soon I got a good deal and ordered immediately.'Everything is as good as mentioned in other reviews: lots of adjustments, good light output, different color temperature, timer, stable stand, good appearance, etc.'I also agree that it would make this light perfect if the USB port can output 2A instead of 1A. I use it to charge cell phone only. So 1A is fine for me.'As a habit, I measure everything measurable when I get a new product. Well, the max power this lamp consumes is 11 Watts. So the output is a bit below 11 Watts. Still, very bright. Actually the highest brightness setting is too bright for continuous reading or working. Both I and my child prefer level 5 for working and reading. Level 7 is good for delicate work, such as examining circuit board, for not more than a few minutes.'bIf you have a 10-11V battery pack, you can use this lamp as an emergency light during a power outage. 1AH from your battery pack will keep this lamp at brightness 7 for almost an hour. Isn't it handy? Of course, you need a cord that can connect your battery pack to this lamp.Added on 30th Jan 2017'bI bought one more for my kid's desk 2 weeks ago. The second one is just as good as the first one. To be picky, I measured and compared the power consumption of both...almost the same. Brightness and color temperature? I don't have a lux meter, but visually, I cannot find a difference between the two units. So I can say the quality control of this lamp is also good.
title: 'One of the best LED Desk Lamp available in that price range'

content: 'The lamp is really bight. It has a couple of little lights on the switch to help you locate the light in the dark. The lamp makes a great night light.'I usually charge my phone at the side of my bed. Unfortunately for me. my wall socket is close to the floor and does not allow me to play with my phone while laying down. The USB port on this lamp fixes that issue. Now I am able to enjoy hours of fun playing with my phone before I sleep.'One draw back I can think of is when a device is plugged in to the USB port or the lamp is on, there is a humming noise you can hear.'
title: 'The lamp makes a great night light'

content: 'bCan't say enough good things about this light. Quiet stylish flicker free light with 5 colour temperature to match your surroundings light and perhaps help with SAD (Seasonal Aftective Disorder) as the colour temperature are approx 6500, 5000, 4000, 3000, and 2700K respectively and they can be set to any one of 7 brightness levels. There is a 60 min timer, night light which is a very nice level, and to top it off there is a 1 Amp USB connector on the rear of the unit for phone charging ( not suitable for iPad or similar). I didn't have an issue with the attachment points as mentioned by previous reviews, but I would be a little careful with it being plastic and all. Excellent for the price and it also comes with a power supply that has cUL approval. Will get for gift for friends.
title: 'Excellent lamp for color applications.A must have for anyone wishing to have a desk lamp to accommodate different lighting needs'

content: 'bI just received my order, two days for standard delivery which was really nice. I'm very impressed by the maximum brightness of this light. I'm a student and it's the first time i've splurged on a lamp and I am very happy with my investment (so far). It's also perfect if you change up your activities (like watching a movie) because you don't have to move it, just dim it down. It's a very good size, I was worried it won't light up my big desk but it's doing an excellent job. I generally don't love how big the base is but the last lamp I had used a clamp and fell multiple times (broke and consequently I purchased this one). Seems to be made of a quality material but I'm still afraid to move the different parts too much. So far i'm very happy with it.

content: 'b This is a very nice desk lamp, many different angle options and lighting options. If you're not aware, at night they say not to be exposed to lots of blue light before bed, that's laptop lights, TV lights, cell phone light etc. With this desk lamp you can put the warm light on and that will not affect your melatonin before bed. That's why apple has this feature in it's newest 9.3 IOS software update.bThere's a usb port in the back of the lamp which is great for powering your cell phone etc. It has a nice glossy black finish which makes any computer desk look extra sharp. It lights up bright enough for my taste at night, I've tested other lights that don't get this bright.Overall it has a nice design and well made, this is a cool desk lamp. I got this one in exchange to make an unbiased review, so that I could provide my best evaluation.'I hope my comments and video help you make an informed decision'cbenzy'
title: 'Great Desk Lamp!!'

content: 'Pros:'- Bright enough for my needs'- Brightness adjustment is quick'- Responsive touch buttons'Cons:'- Flimsier than expected'- Swivel at the base is very limited'- Biggest issue with this lamp is the high pitched noise coming from the light. Not sure if it happens with other dimming lamps, but this one has the noise at any brightness level other than the highest. Happens on all modes, and is worse when something is plugged in charging from the USB port.'

content: 'I previously bought a bunch of lamps (some of them being good brands) and spent a lot of money, but none were as good as i expected them to be. This one here is truly satisfying ! Its lightweight (2.8 pounds/1.27kg) yet it feels like very good quality material. It has 7 levels of brightness for every situation you need, plus a very soft light to use before sleeping or even while doing so. It also has 5 types of lights going from bright white to yellow, adjustable on a touch panel. This lamp provides an auto-off timer that automatically turns the light off after an hour. The base is very rigid so no need to worry about the lamp falling or accidentally moving. The lamp has different adjustments, so it can be placed almost everywhere without worrying about the light not reaching specific places. Its eco-friendly and uses 75% less energy with an estimated 50000 hours lifespan (so its also pocket-friendly !). It also has a usb slot for charging your phone (or other devices) which is very practical. I am extremely happy with this lamp and i\'m sure it will last me years and years seeing what it\'s made of !'If this review was helpful or answered some of your questions, please give it a thumbs up so i can know for future reviews. Thank you !'
title: 'Beautiful ergonomic design and very soft on the eyes'

content: ' First LED desk lamp I have owned and it definitely met my expectations. I thought the lamp would be less study than it is, did not think it would be so bright and the color temperatures are a fantastic addition. If you are looking for a desk lamp then I would highly recommend this one for the brightness and color temperature settings alone.'Positives:'- Solid construction, I thought the lamp would wobble more than it does (barely noticeable).'- 1A usb port for charging devices built into the base.'- Different Light temperatures which you can change depending on the usage.'- Very flexible, you can bend each section of the lamp 90 degrees or more, the LED part also bends side to side.'- Looks great, high gloss finish.'- Buttons are responsive, they are touch sensitive and work very well.'- Very bright on high setting, I can light my whole room up using it if I want too, also the low setting is perfect for late nights without straining eyes.'- Has a built in timer if you are prone to falling asleep.'Negatives:'- High gloss finish means it is a finger print magnet.'- USB port could have been 2A but that would have also required a better power adapter.'Price is a bit on the high side but honestly with all the features it is well worth the bit of extra cash. The only thing I would like to see changed is the USB port and possibly a non glossy finish.'
title: 'Awesome desk light.'

content: 'bI love that I can fold it away when i'm not using it, as I only use it when I'm drawing or need better lighting for a detail oriented task. I LOVE that I can change the color temperature on it. I prefer a warmer light in general but being able to have the appropriate lighting for a particular task is important when color accuracy is needed. Being easily able to change the intensity with a quick slide of the finger is a great added bonus, as is the convenient USB port on the back. I have yet to be disappointed with any Aukey product.
title: 'bI love that I can fold it away when i'm not ...

content: 'bIt looks sharp, has a good range of adjustment, dimmable and colour adjustment. It produces lots of light for a desk lamp and the light is long enough that there are no hard shadows. Right now I'm using it two steps dimmer then full, and two steps warmer then the coldest setting. When you turn it on it remembers where it was set last.bI plugged it into my watt meter and it draws 10 watts at full brightness, a bit less then the rated 12 watts, it's only 6 watts at the setting I'm using (less then an old style night light). I also tested the USB charging port and my tester showed 5.01 volts and 1.15 amps so spot on for the voltage, and slightly better then advertised on current, Veery good.bOver all very good for the price. The only negative would be the location of the power control that I expect to have at the far left, but that's the timer button, the power is second. I would also like a way to feel the power control like a dimple or bump.I may buy a second one for my bed side table.'update: After using it for a few weeks the only other wish I have would be one more brightness step dimmer then the current range.'
title: 'Looks nice, works great'

content: 'This lamp has been great. I love all the functions:'b1) it's dimmable, with 5 settings,2) night light setting, for extreme low light,'b3) Off-Timer - which is great for the times you have a book in bed and not sure when it's going to put you to sleep,4) Cool/warmth setting - able to change lighting intensity from cool to warm colour lightning and'5) Extremely flexible - almost all the parts of the lamp are adjustable, giving it great desk utility'bIt is extremely quiet with no buzzing noises which I hated with my last lamp. It also has a very solid base with enough weight so there's no chance of it tipping over. Stylist lamp and great build quality all around.
title: 'Great lamp with nice list of features...'

content: 'bI have this lamp for 6 months now without any issues. The lamp works exactly as described. It is not made of any premium metallic material and just basically a plastic construction but that is alright as long as it functions well. It has many part to swivel to get the light in the direction you want to set up. It has 7 brightness adjustment and 5 different light color mode to choose. It can get really bright, more than enough for night time study and reading. I also appreciate it has a night mode which turn on 1 dim LED if you want it at night to get around instead of walking in the dark. There's the timer, I personally has not used it but I can see that it'd be useful for many people. Overall I'd recommend this product :)
title: 'As advertised!'

content: 'The lamp works marvelously.'Touch buttons on the base of the lamp as well as a USB port in the back of the base for charging devices.'5 dimmer toggles for varying amounts of light.'The light has white light and a choice to toggle to yellow variances of light.'bThere is a timer mode that I haven't used very often.This is a great item and worth the price.'

content: 'This desk lamp has several different features that I enjoyed - a couple minor things but no biggie, this has now become the lamp at my bedside!'bI love being able to control the warmth and brightness of the light. I'm able to put it on low in the evenings, or higher in the mornings if need be. It's also able to be very bright white or warmer similar to an incandescent bulb. There is also a nightlight function that only illuminates the tip of the lamp giving off very little light as not to disturb others around you.bThe build is a fairly sturdy plastic, although it is prone to fingerprints and dust. It's lightweight and easy to move positions or take to another desk if need be in a pinch. All buttons along the base of the lamp are touch sensitive. I would have liked there to be some ridges or bumps for the power button, making it easier to find when the lamp is off and you cannot see.bThere is also a charging port coming out of the backside, saving you an outlet or making your charger more accessible while on your desk. Keep in mind that this is a 1A charger meaning it will charge devices pretty slowly - not a deal breaker if you're charging overnight.bOverall I'm definitely pleased with this lamp and as stated above it has become my new bedside lamp. With variable light modes and settings, a usb port, and adjustable frame, this is sure to be useful for a variety of home or office spaces.This product was provided for review purposes, I have only promised my unbiased and honest opinion.'
title: 'Great choice for a bedside lamp'

content: 'Included in the package:'-Manual'-Base of the light'-Cleaning Cloth'-Power Supply Cable'-The light'Design and Functionality:'bLet me start of by saying that this lamp is very worth it. It functions very well offering 4 modes with adjustable lighting levels. This light also offers a USB port on the side to charge and sub charged devices. It has two modes a 60 minute mode and an on/off mode as well as 4 different variations when it is on. The 4 variations are sleep, study, reading and relaxing. They each offer different colours to suit type of activity and not stress your eyes. The light is very bright but can be very dim if needed. It is very sturdy and won't be knocked over easily. The light folds in half so it can have less space to take up and also can be rotated and flexed out to get the perfect lighting angle. This light would be perfect for any computer desk to help study or read. Overall this is a great light with very bright LED's, the light hardly takes up space and can charge devices off of it as well as have 4 modes. Overall for the price it is worth it and would easily be a 5/5 but more to a 6/5.Pros:'-Adjustable angle'b-Bright LED's (can be dimmed)-Charges devices off of it'-Compact'-Lightweight'-Different Modes'Suggestions:'-Should have a controller or an app to control the colours or modes remotely to make it easier'

content: 'Pros:'1. Bright enough for me.'2. Nice touch controls.'3. Light output (level) adjustability.'4. Some adjustability of color temperature (the modes).'5. USB charging port that is amply powered.'7. Low power usage versus incandescent or halogen.'Cons:'1. Wall wart power supply, but thats not a huge problem really'Overall:'great LED light, another plus for LEDs vs regular fluorescent'Details:'I really like this light. I have the piano black one. It is a very shiny black, much like a piano. It shows dust and fingerprints very well. The base is a 7 square with rounded corners. This light is spec\'ed at 3.3 pounds.There is a rubber/foam pad that covers the entire bottom so it won\'t slide around too much or scratch delicate surfaces. The top surface of the base is not entirely flat.The power cord has a wall wart (100-240V, 50/60Hz) at the end. It is 5 feet long. The connection to the lamp is the traditional round jack connection as opposed to a USB type of jack. The output is 12V at 1.5A. Not 5V like a USB supply would be. Obviously, the output at the USB charging jack is 5V. When first plugged in the default light mode is Reading mode at the middle brightness level (there are 5 levels for each of the 4 color temperature settings). All the other modes also default to the middle level after being plugged in. Controls seem to be capacitive. You do not have to press any switches. Just barely touching the desired control activates it. There is a + and - control to adjust each mode\'s brightness level. You have to tap + or - to go to the next level as opposed to just holding your finger there while it adjusts up or down. Once the lamp is powered it remembers the last light level for each mode when you power off and back on again and it comes on in the mode you last had it in. It does not go to the defaults like it does when initially applying power. It is specified as being 18 tall when the lamp assembly is horizontal to the work surface and the vertical arm is vertical. That is 18 to the top side of the lamp module. It is actually about 17.5 to the bottom side of the lamp (where the LEDs are). There are two rows of 9 bright white LEDs and one row of 9 dimmer, yellower LEDs in the middle for a total of 27 LEDs. The different modes use different combinations and levels of these LEDs. Reading mode is the brightest using all rows. Study is the same except the yellower LED row is just slightly dimmer than in Reading mode. In Relax mode the white LED rows are dimmed to about half of the Reading mode level while the yellow LEDs are at the same level. The sleep mode uses only the yellow LED row at about the same level as the Relax and Reading modes. The brightest setting is plenty bright for me, although that is highly subjective based on your own personal needs. The box rates it at 550 lumens. The LEDs are pretty bright if you look right at them and barely get warm to the touch at their brightest setting. No need to worry about kids touching it. The USB port is a very nice convenience feature and is rated at 1 amp so it charges my phone at the same rate as the factory charger.'
title: 'Nice touch controls'

content: 'Spending more than 8 hours each day tied to our desks, we do not realize the importance of proper lighting'bGetting additional light at your workspace I crucial to stay focused and finish all your tasks on time aka to keep your job 'As a person who wears hard contact lenses and sleeps only 4-6 hours each day, this lamp from TaoTronics is an excellent edition to my work desk.'I love that I can charge my devices, adjust the angle and the brightness with one touch.'Very elegant modern and simple design, which can fit into any office or home.'Highly recommend this product'Increase your productivity'
title: 'this lamp from TaoTronics is an excellent edition to my work desk'

content: 'I am truly impressed with the rapid and polite customer service It seems you truly care about customer reviews.'PROS: a) the Leds are as advertised and work on 4 different settings' b) The body of the lamp has the ability to rotate which is lacking in with the competitor OXYLED lamps' c) Sunvalleytek Canada has EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE,;'CONS:'a) Also since, the lamp already has a spine that bends ( being able to move it up or down), I find it redundant that the head(where the leds are) of the lamp also moves up and down. It would have been better if the head could tilt instead.'b)'I am also concerned about its durability; it is a bit too light and will eventually break if too much pressure is put on.'c) Last but not least, the timer is completely pointless in my opinion; LED lamps do not take alot of electricity anyways and having a timer is an unnecessary compartment'All in all, there is nothing defective about the lamp but it seems too fragile and due to the concerns I listed above the lamp should be worth around $40 - $50. 0.'However, if the CONS a) and b) are fixed the lamp will be worth its original price. Otherwise I would recommend buying a used version of this lamp for a lesser price.'
title: '- spine adjustable is redundant with the head of the lamp (2 features that allow the same function)--;expensive'

content: 'Lamp is pretty good, but mines started to melt and now will not turn off, probably something shorted/melted. Product is good while it lasted, but now I just have a paperweight.'bAlso, it melts exactly one year after purchase. I can't recommend. I'll try to submit an RMA, will update if they have customer service or not.Update 10/2/2015: Seller messaged me quickly and is generously offering a replacement for my faulty lamp. I am impressed for now, but will see once the lamp is replaced.'
title: 'bIt's good, when it works.

content: 'bI've been using for a few months now and it still works great. The touch buttons are a great feature and the wide range of lighting options really suit the mood. I tend to alternate between Relax for the warm color and Study to help stay awake when actually studying. The adjustability of the lamp is greatI can shine light on just about anywhere in the room. The f'n to sleep after 60 mins is a great feature and changing the intensity of the light is one of the best parts about this lamp. And I would like to add one of my utmost favourite feature is the USB port, as I have this lamp close to my bed side and it's easy for me to just plug in my iPhone and place on the counter beside me. Overall this was a great buy and at a cheap price.Pros:'Good feel on the base, no need to worry for the lamp to tip over'Perfect lamp for a desk'Great range on types of lighting, from warm to fluorescent lighting to suit the mood'Able to change the brightness of the light for each setting (Sleep, Relax, Study, Reading)'60 minute off timer'Adjustability of the lamp to reach anywhere in the room'Sleek design and easy to clean'USB PORT!'Cons:'The top portion of the lamp (everything but the base) feels like cheap plastic. Not cheap enough to snap in half (still reliable to bend) though if it were made of a better material it would be the ideal lamp'bNot sure how I'll be able to change the bulbs when the time comes, I think I might end up buying another one as I have not experienced the customer servicebEDIT (July 18, 2017 ): I've bee using this lamp since 2015 and it's still going strong as my main desk lamp. Things I would have liked to change is to have the lamp rotate a full 360 degrees and be slightly brighter. Overall I still don't regret the purchase and everything still working well!
title: '5/5 Would buy again!'

content: 'I really like this lamp and the varying light levels (sleep, relax, study, reading) it offers as well as the one USB port (plan to charge my iphone using this). The base of the lamp is heavy so I am not expecting the lamp to tip if bumped. However, even though I bought it when it was on sale, I was disappointed to find that the arm is plastic and not what I was expecting. I would think for the price nothing would be plastic. The glossy black finish allows fingerprints and dust to show up all too well, so it was nice to see a decent cleaning cloth was included. Delivery was very fast and the box it came in kept everything secure. I am very happy with my purchase and after looking around at other lamps, I have decided to order a second one.'
title: 'I really like this lamp and the varying light levels (sleep'

content: 'bI was surprised at the lack of quality in the materials. For a $130 lamp, I would expect it to be entirely made of metal, but instead -- other than the metal base -- it's made of cheap plastic. The joints don't feel solid at all and it wobbles when you adjust it.bI got it on sale for $60, which still feels a bit overpriced. $30-$40 is probably more what I think it's worthbOther than that it's alright. I just expected a higher-quality desk lamp.
title: 'I was surprised at the lack of quality in the ...'

content: 'bI really liked this lamp when I got it. However just after about an hour, all buttons was keeping blinking in red. Then I tried to turn on it again, every time I pressed the on/off button, it just lighted for 2-3 seconds, pressing models buttons also didn't work. The buttons just kept blinking in red whole night I think. This morning I found it just turn on for 3 seconds itself without any pressing on buttons for 4-5 times when I lying on my bed, and I woke up found all buttons are not blinking, they are even worse, they are not working at all. I tried to press on/off button to see if I can turn on the light but it didn't work no matter how i pressed it. I sent email to company they have not replied me anything until now. I really angry about this product because yesterday night I had so many projects to do and I really needed this lamp. This product just terrible.
title: 'I really liked this lamp when I got it'

content: 'bI love these! It's made working, reading, relaxing, etc. so much better. The different light settings, which have little hues of warmth in additional to brightness, really make a huge difference. I wish I found out about these products earlier.
title: 'bI love these! It's made working

content: 'bThis is an LED lamp with all the power savings and lifetime you'd expect from a high quality LED but the adjustable color spectrum is pleasantly surprising as it can also appear warm and welcoming instead of cold and efficient, which is what I've been used to with LEDs or most of today's power saving bulbs. I like that this lamp is nice and high and that it includes a charging usb port. At first I thought that the Reading Mode could go a bit brighter, but upon testing with reading material it is exquisitely suitable for reading and study. There is however one major flaw to this lamp, that almost made me return it. The lamp is adjustable any which way, except for the top arm itself where the light is being emitted from. In other words, you can tilt and turn every part of this lamp except for the most critical part, in my opinion. which is the top, that you cannot tilt horizontally away from your eyes (only lower it vertically, which is pretty useless). So if your desk and chair are at a certain height, you will be faced with a light that is glaring into your eyes as you are trying to read or write. This will include many people as this is quite a tall desk lamp. This is annoying to me and a major oversight that a $70+ lamp should not have. It almost made me give up on this lamp. I did however do a quick little DIY and taped a strip of black construction paper to block out the rays hitting my eyes. It did the trick, fortunately! Nevertheless, I think a lamp of this quality and at this price point ought to have a horizontal tilting head or at least an attachable shade of some sorts, to block the light hitting our eyes. Overall, good lamp, but not perfect. If it will last for the 45k hours as advertised (doubtful, to be honest), I'll be old and happy.bUpdate: So after 3 years of daily usage for study, reading and relaxation in my home, I am happy to report that this lamp still works very well. I just checked the display panel and all of the little 27 LED bulbs light up, just as bright as the day I bought it. All of the 4 lighting modes work perfect too. So this lamp is no cheap toy, but a durable and well made tool. I still use it with a strip of black paper to block out the rays from hitting my eyes and I am happy with this solution. At the current price that it goes for (much lower than 3 years ago), I don't think you can go wrong with this lamp.
title: 'Good Lamp With an Almost Fatal Flaw to Consider. 3 Year Update Included At The End of Review!'

content: 'Gave only 4 stars instead of 5 for two reasons: 1) The lights for the Reading, Study, Relax, and Sleep are red. I absolutely despise red light in my room. The 60 min timer light makes the power button blink red. A bit annoying but I will live. I can cover the lights with an item if I need to.'2) I wish that the bottom hinge pivoted back slightly but it does not. It would just help with the positioning of where I have the lamp.'Literally the greatest lamp I have ever owned other than the two cons I mentioned, for the functionality and usefulness. The USB port makes it easier to charge headphones with such a short cord. The base is a handy tray to rest the headphones, wireless earbuds, or phone on while charging. I absolutely love that there are options for dimming or increasing the brightness for each setting. It helps that the light is also able to pivot on the base. I was afraid that it was in the fixed position. The base is heavy too, which is great.'I would buy TaoTronics products again.'
title: 'Worth the money.'

With the older model the neck was bendable steel so I would last a long time and not get lose, This on the other hand I'm not sure sure of, Just wondering how , on before the light on the top part will get lose and no longer hold with its joints.

content: 'Updated Review:'Although my warranty was over, after my review was read by customer service of TaoTronics, they contacted me and apologized for the inconvenience and sent a brand new replacement for free.'I wish that the earlier problem had been just an occasional defect in the material, however I increased my review from 1-star to 3-star due to the excellent customer service of TaoTronics in sending a replacement for an out of warranty item.'========================================='Old Review:'After 1 year the plastic material around the joints degraded and broke into pieces in several different locations and rendered the whole device useless.'Happened by itself without applying any force or movement and only few days after the end of warranty.'I had hold the LED device near my bed in a very neat condition and even barely used it.'It does not even have a scratch on it but useless.'Attached photo is very informative.'I am totally unsatisfied with this purchase.'
title: 'Received a replacement, I hope this one would be different.'

content: 'Pros.- it does everything that it says it will do. The light output is fully variable between bright and dim. The base is quite sturdy, but the lamp itself will not take much abuse.'Cons - Generally, you want a lamp like this to do one of two things. Directly illuminate your work while being out of the way, or high enough above your work space so that it illuminates a larger area. This lamp does not really do either for me. It is too short to use directly in front of a 24 computer monitor as it gets in the way of the screen. The lack of a swivel mount for the angle of the LED\'s makes this problem even worse, as the light shines in my eyes if I try to illuminate a larger area of my desk.'Perhaps this would be perfect as a task light, but as a Desk Lamp, it tends to fail a little bit.'
title: 'Good, but has some flaws when used as a desk lamp.'

content: 'bBought this a month back and was surprised at the quality, solid built with a nice weight to the base. Lighting options are decent and this lamp can get very bright. The thing that jumped out to me was the box (go figure) I bought this as a lightning deal and as such kinda figured it would be some cheap built and ship product... and I was fine with that, but. Man! the box is amazing lol I felt like this was a Rolex of lamps black molded foam cut perfected to the lamp and heavy gauge cardboard box. Kudos to the manufacture to show that this really is a premium lamp, and it is a premium lamp. My only complaint is that the arms don't have any backward movement only strait up and down and forward and I personally wanted some backwards movements so that i could have it sit a bit lower but thats the only issue that i can complain about and i would think not everyone will agree with me as this is a personal preference. So to summarize, if you want a solid desk/nightstand lamp this is your guy.
title: 'Well put together and does the jo

content: 'bI am so pleased with this lamp. I'm a jewelry maker and artist and needed something that is a space saver on my studio table. And also something that is bright enough to see the finer details of my work. Because I work with my hands in polymer clay or paint, I like the easy touch controls on the lamp. I don't have to fiddle with nobs or switches. I can use it to charge my phone or tablet while working. I like being able to adjust the angle. Personally, I'm not a fan of LED lighting. I often find it too glaring for a table lamp. But this illuminates my space brilliantly, yet is comfortable for the eyes. I highly recommend this product!
title: 'Great light for office/art studio work!'

content: 'BIEN'
title: 'Three Stars'

content: 'bWe just finished a home renovation which included a new home office space and were in need of a new desklamp. We tried our first LED desklamp a couple years ago and were quite impressed. They reduce eye strain and provide a pleasant amount of light which seems more natural. LEDs are extremely energy efficient and consume up to 90% less power than incandescent bulbs. Since LEDs use only a fraction of the energy of an incandescent light bulb there is a dramatic decrease in power costs. LED's are durable and generate virtually no heat which is also a huge benefit. Unfortunately, our last one made its way to our daughters dorm at university so we decided to order another for our new home office.We came across this TaoTronics Dimmable LED Desk Lamp which is the same manufacturer as our first LED desktop lamp. This one looked even better and had more features so we decided to order it. Shipping was super fast and it was well packaged. Inside the Amazon shipping box, the unit itself was packed in an attractive box with a convenient handle. Inside contained an easy to read and detailed instruction manual, a power adapter and the lamp unit itself in 2 parts. Putting the lamp together was straight forward...you just place the main unit in the bottom of the base and screw a locking part from underneath which secures the unit to the base.'The first thing we noticed about this was how much more durable it seemed than our last one, and its size. This thing is substantial and has the look and feel of a much more expensive lamp. It adjusts and swivels at every joint which allows it to manuever to whichever position works best at the time or for who is using it. The capacitive touch controls feel rich and worked well but what we found the best feature was the different lighting modes and the light that is produced. It truly is a refreshing and natural light that this unit produces which we found actually eye soothing, yet it is bright enough to do the job well. The USB charging port is also a great feature.'bWe are super happy with this purchase and are considering buying a second so we can take advantage of the lower settings and the auto-shutoff timer by placing it on a bedroom nightstand. We definitely recommend this product and with the warranty and support provided by TaoTronics, you can't go wrong.
title: 'Attractive, durable and feature rich desk lamp'

content: 'I was very impressed with how clean / modern & durable looking this lamp is, in the box you get the lamp, a power cord, instructions and a soft cleaning cloth, the base is weighted and more than adequate for this product. Assembly was very simple. As a bonus there is a USB charging port to cable your phone or other accessories to when they need to charge. You have two pivot points from which you can make physical adjustments depending on how close or far away from your work surface you want the light to be and at the base the arm can swivel, the settings on the lamp are very intuitive and marked with easy to understand icons, study mode, relaxed mode, sleep mode, brightness can be adjusted as well. The lamp auto times out after roughly 1 hour so its good for those that may forget to turn it off at night or during the day as well, one way to save a little electricity if you are forgetful at times. I would recommend this product both for an office / work environment or student study area.'
title: 'Modern Looking & Very Functional'

content: '[PRODUCT]'Purchased during a lightning sale for $35.19, but besides the price it was mainly due to its\' height and different light modes. It\'s tall enough to reach over 24 monitors and the Sleep light setting is perfect at night. It\'s also fairly adjustable, although I wish the top part of the lamp could rotate around like the higher end model that\'s made of metal. Regardless, it\'s a nice desk lamp with all of its\' adjustable features.'[SUPPORT]'bWhen I first received the desk lamp from Amazon, several of the buttons near the bottom would not always respond when you touched them. As I found out, Amazon has a strict no-exchange policy on fulfillment orders. They have no problem refunding your purchase but since I bought it during a lightning sale, there's no way to repurchase it at the same price. Hence, why exchange policies matter.Obviously since Amazon was no help and the product does come with a warranty, I contacted TaoTronics. In a matter of a couple days, they had offered to send out a replacement unit. I received the new unit within a couple days and tested that it works perfectly. So if you ever have problems with TaoTronic products, know that communicating with the company/seller is a breeze.'
title: 'Great Support, Working Replacement Arrived Within 2 Days'

content: 'For the price of this, I think it can be better. Two complaints from me. One, the controls must rotate with the lamp, so it is not as flexible as I expected. The lamp is limited to angles where the controls must be facing out. Two, the lamp strip can only open and close. There is no rotational axle for shining the light from the side, so the light must shine straight down. Three, the USB charging port is useless. The output is only 0.45 amp max. Phones need at least 1.0amp to charge at a decent speed nowadays. 0.45amp would take me 2.5hours to charge 20%.'
title: 'Could be better'

content: 'I was looking for an LED lamp for months to put on my desk since nothing I was saw out in the stores-in and online were portable/small enough to fit on my desk.'bFirst of all, the build quality is very, very good! The material used feels premium and the lamp is actually flexible which is nice! Everything is very sturdy and the LED's look very bright and you even have a choice to dim them by just pressing this little pad on the surface (it's touch sensitive) of the lamp that will go through different dimming options. (Reading/Studying/Relaxation/Bedtime)Love the lamp for its affordability and its functions, would definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for a modular desk lamp for whatever you want use it for!'
title: 'LOVE IT!'

content: 'bShiny plastic gets scratched pretty easily and looks like it's really old or dirty. A matte design would have been much better.Flimsy build overall, however, the reason for the 3 stars is that functionality wise it does a great job offering 4 light settings and brightness adjustment and it can get quite bright.'Customer Service has reached out to resolve, will update!'
title: 'Poor Design and Flimsy - Great Functionality'

content: 'Straight up: I received this lamp as part of a review program. No cost - but in exchange for a balanced review. Well, I can tell that after using this for a few days, I will likely be ordering a second (and paying for it). Why? It has an exceptional number of features for the price.'First off, you can adjust the preset colour temperature of its nine LEDs. There are brighter (whiter) modes for reading and study - and warmer, more amber tones for relaxing and sleep. And - trust me - you can feel the difference between them. The first two are more energizing, while the relax and sleep modes make you feel like doing exactly that.'bEach of those colours has five brightness levels - allowing you to select precisely what feels right. The LEDs will likely last longer than you will - so it's exceedingly unlikely you'll be replacing them.bOne final feature that's cool: You can fold the lamp down against its vertical stand while turned on. The stand itself has a vertical slit that allows the light to pass through and illuminate the area BEHIND the lamp, providing a subtle backlit glow of indirect light. Very clever. At the price - even at full retail price - this is a fantastic lamp. And, honestly, I'm not just saying that because I'm in the program.bFlaws? I'm guessing the glossy piano black finish will show up dust and possibly fingerprints. But a soft cloth is provided for that purpose. Read the other reviews - this many people can't be wrong. Hope you found this helpful - and happy shopping. Scott.TaoTronics Elune TT-DL01 Dimmable LED Desk Lamp with 4 lighting Modes: Reading/ Studying/ Relaxation/ Bedtime, 5-Level Dimmer, Touch-Sensitive Control Panel, 1-Hour Auto Timer, Built-in 5V/1A USB Charging Port -Piano Black'
title: 'bFilled with features you won't find on other lamps!

content: 'I must admit, I have a bit of a problem when it comes to furnishing my rooms with LED Lamps. I find myself browsing Amazon, looking at the various models and comparing their design and features. There were so many, it was hard to narrow it down at first.'bHowever, when I saw Sunvalleytek (parent company of TaoTronics) had a new 5-Level Dimmable LED Desk Lamp, I figured I'd give it a shot. I've owned several products from them, including their awesome power banks, desktop chargers, and other electronics over the years. Well, as soon as I unpacked the TT-DL01 LED Desk Lamp out of the box, I was pleasantly surprised that the design looked as nice as it does in the pictures and that I made a good choice. It's very sleek and the Piano Black finish makes it look very nice wherever I have it in my house.bThe design is pretty simplistic. There are 4 Pre-Set Lighting Modes: Reading Mode, Study Mode, Relax Mode, and Sleep Mode. There is also a brightness control (+ or -) and a 60-minute timer. I found the timer an especially useful feature because sometimes I would come into the room for a little bit and then end up at a different end of the house or find myself leaving with forgetting to turn it off. This way, I had 60 minutes before the lamp would automatically turn off and thus save me money on my power bill. I've also used this feature when I had similar lamps positioned near my bed, because it gives me about 60 minutes of solid reading/tablet browsing time before I know I need to get to bed (would work great for college kids too).bOverall, I have to say this lamp is worth every penny. There's a reason why it's not the cheapest on the market.... it's made of high quality materials that will last several years. I think this would be a great holiday gift to anyone because we could all use a lamp. :)
title: 'bOne Of The Best LED Lamps I've Ever Owned

content: 'bWhen I looked for a good desk lamp I never thought one could have so many innovative features. I love the build quality as well as the design of the lamp. The lamp folds down to a very compact straight line when not in use. On the bottom of the jointed part are the touch controls which allows you to access any of the setting options. The base is heavy enough so you don't have to be afraid of knocking it off.The lamp has 4 different lighting modes. Reading is a cool, daylight kind of light. Study is a little less bright and has a more warm, yellow tint. Relax is a very warm color which works great for ambient lighting. Sleep is a mood lighting. Very warm and great to have a light when you lay in bed and relax. There is also a 60 minutes timer that turns the lamp off after 1 hour. This is great for the sleep mode so you don\'t waste any electricity when you don\'t need it. The are also + and - controls which allow you to adjust the brightness manually.'This lamp consists of 27 small LED lights divided into different tones. LED lights are environment friendly and use less energy than incandescent lights. Another great future which I use now on a daily basis is the USB charging port on the side which can charge you phone, tablet or iPod.'As you can read I was quite impressed by the design and functionality of this lamp. I can highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good desk lamp. Big thanks to TaoTronics for providing this lamp for review!'
title: 'Impressive design and features!'

content: 'This is an excellent choice for a lamp to use on a desk, by a chair, or on a nightstand, or for a gift that will really be used and appreciated. Because it uses LEDs, it will even pay for itself in a few years in energy savings, compared to a 60 W incandescent.'It is full-size, standing about 18 in. (46 cm) tall when the lower arm is vertical and the upper arm is horizontal. The lamp swivels a full 180 degrees and has two hinges, so it can hover over a book or light the entire desk surface.'The base is weighted for stability and the top surface is slightly indented to hold a smartphone or pens, with a 1 amp USB charging port that is really convenient. It has a glossy finish all over and a microfiber polishing cloth is included, along with nominal 5 ft. (1.5 m) power cable with wall adapter.'The LEDs provide exactly the amount and quality of light needed for activities from watching television to reading or detail work. The touch panel is easy to use and allows control of both the quality and quantity of light through the interplay of eighteen cool white LEDs and nine warm white LEDS. The blend of LEDs is an unusual feature if not a unique one, and it really makes a difference.'There are four main modes that go from dim to bright and warm to white. Each of the four main modes can be further adjusted up or down a couple of steps for precise control over brightness and a total of twenty different settings. There is even a one-hour timer for bedtime reading.'bOverall, I don't know of another light with similar features and quality, and it is handsome, too!TaoTronics provided an Elune for evaluation and review.'
title: 'Excellent light quality with precision control'

content: 'bThis lamp has all of the features that I look for in a good desk lamp and some that I'd never thought of. First of all, I love the sleek look and the way it adjusts to so many different positions. You can fold the shade part down against the main arm, so it stands up and down in a straight line when you're not using it. There is also a jointed part just above the touch controls near the base where you can tilt it forward, so you have a lot of options for lighting a large area of your desk. The base is heavy enough that I don't worry about one of the cats knocking it over and if you remove it by unscrewing it from the rest of the lamp it can be stored in a small amount of space. It would be great for use in a student dorm or in an office where it might be moved often.There are actually 27 small LED lights in this lamp. They are lit in different combinations to produce a wide variety of different lighting. One, marked Reading is a bright, daylight type of light that I would describe as cool. This is great for working or reading small print where you need an intense light. The next is one called Study which is a little different tone, not quite as intense, but still pretty bright and a little different color tone. Next there is a Relax light which is a warmer toned light that looks similar to an incandescent bulb, one you might leave on for regular ambient lighting or doing things where you don\'t need a strong light. The next is called Sleep which is more like mood lighting, very soft and warm. This one is nice to use with the 60 minute timer that will turn the light off after an hour. (Great for reading in bed.) In addition to these four different types of light that you can choose, there is also a - and + control where you can adjust any of the 4 levels, making them dimmer or brighter by degrees, just by tapping it, to suit your taste. So it really has more than four lighting levels. These are all touch controls that you just tap to operate and the active one lights up with a tiny red light.'bI like the LED lights because they are low energy and friendlier to the environment. They use about 80 to 90% less energy than an incandescent light. The ones in this lamp are rated to last 45,000 hours. That means that even if you used it for 8 hours every single day, it would last over 15 years! It says it takes 14 watts but when using the softer lights it probably uses even less. Another really nice feature is that it has a USB port near the base where you can plug in your iPhone, iPod or other mp3 player or tablet and charge it while you're working. (Or even after you've turned it off.) This is really handy when you're short on outlets.Taotronics, the manufacturer, really put a lot of thought into the function and design features in this lamp. The quality really shows and it has become a big favorite in our home.'
title: 'A very impressive desk lamp with lots of features and options,'

content: 'This is quite a nice desk lamp with lots of lighting options.'Pros:'* Flexible design with multiple pivots allows for a lot of configurations'* Easy to find (in the dark) on button because it\'s lit up in red'* Different modes provide different color temperatures in the range of (2000K-6500K). For reference, a standard incandescent bulb is about 2700K in color temperature and daylight bulbs are bluer at around 6500K.'* Has a CRI >90 which means high-quality lighting (good color rendition)'* Selectable multiple levels of brightness'* Multiple low power LEDs make for very efficient & eco-friendly lighting with low heat output'* Timer option to automatically turn the light off in one hour'* Built-in USB charging port (5V, up to 1A)'* Responsive touch controls'* Attractive design'Negatives:'* Manual could use some proofreading'* Price is higher than many other desk lamps (though you get what you pay for)'* Black finish easily picks up fingerprints but it comes with a microfiber cloth to clean them'Other:'b* Up to 530 lumens of light (note that this is less than a 60 watt incandescent bulb, but because the LEDs shine down, it may seem just as bright, but don't expect it to be as bright as a 100 watt incandescent bulb)bWith so many positives and no serious negatives, I'm giving this desk lamp 5 stars.NOTE: I was sent a free product sample for review. I was not paid or told what to write.'
title: 'Nice energy efficient lighting with lots of options'

content: 'Love this light. Needed a light over my computer desk and this fits the bill.'Easy to set up and adjust, bigger than I would have thought from pictures and much much brighter than any desk light I have owned before.'All the settings are easy to use and with 5 dimming settings it can adjust to exactly what I want quickly and easily.'I am trying to figure out another place to put one as it is so nice. Best Xmas gift I could have asked for...'
title: 'Fantastic !'

content: 'Quite impressed with this LED Desk Lamp.'bShipping was quick. The packaging was well designed and compact. Felt like a high quality item straight from opening the box. Very simple assembly (didn't even read the instructions, was obvious).I was impressed with the different lighting modes, as well as the brightness each mode provides. I\'ve replaced my current desk lamp with this item. It\'s quite ergonomic and I\'ve been able to adjust it at the correct viewing angles. I\'m a graduate student and I find it quite useful when either reading text material or working on my computer. I particularly like the relaxed lighting settings when it gets later into the night.'The USB charging port is a nice touch, as I can charge my phone, bluetooth headset, or speakers directly beside my lamp without occupying a port from my computer, and without having to use my USB hub.'bOverall, I suggest this purchase to people looking for a desk lamp. Particularly useful to students and performance users due to the multiple modes and levels of brightness. Beats the standard lamp that's for certain!
title: 'Great product offering by TaoTronics, get this lamp.'

content: 'bAbsolutely love this lamp! Easy to use and install. Comes with 4 preset modes (sleep, reading, studying and relaxing) Can also increase or decrease brightness according to your specific needs. Adjustable. Built in timer goes off after 1 hour. Built in USB port for charging your phone or other device. Compact, doesn't take up to much space. Fits nicely on coffee or bed side table. Would definitely recommend. Worth every penny! Last lamp you'll ever need
title: 'Love Love Love!!'

content: 'I bought this lamp to help make things a bit brighter around the house at night time. I love curling up on my couch with a good book and banging my head into the lamp over and over again. It truly makes me feel alive! My husband and kids bought one each as well so we can all enjoy banging our heads into our lamps. They are extremely robust and have brought our little moth family closer together than ever.'
title: 'We love lamp.'

content: 'Never had a desk lamp or any lamp as functional as this one. Even in the four individual lighting modes it remembers which of the four brightness levels you last used in either the sleep,coffee,study,or reading mode. A lot of lamp and a USB port to boot, the price is more than reasonable and it looks classy.'
title: 'Never had a desk lamp or any lamp as functional ...'

content: 'Very versatile, futuristic and excellent quality. Goes from very bright daylight to yellowish soft light. Nice finish, I have my PC screen made with exact same type of finish so it looks like a set. It take little space on the desk. The only minor problem is that collects dust so you have to remove it periodically but it comes as well with a microfiber cloth that works well. An antistatic spray I think can solve this easily.'I am happy with this purchase and I recommend it.'
title: 'Stylish versatile lamp'

content: 'bWas given to me as gift from parents when they heard that I have trouble sleeping. This lamp is amazing for the bedside bc of its warm light option. And the brightness of each type of light is even adjustable!! Love it so much. Also the touch buttons are amazing, so my roommate doesn't have to hear the click of my precious lamp when I turn it off to go to sleep. It even comes with a timer option which I don't use but I could see why it would be handy. The only thing to improve on is the size of the power button; a little small in my opinion but it does the job so far. The base is huge which is nice for me as a girl bc I always have little things like hair ties around my bed side so I just store it there. And finally recently found that it has a USB port, so handy. The look is also sleek and modern. LOVE THIS LAMP! Parents, buy it for your college kids haha we wouldn't spend the money on something like this but it's amazing.
title: 'Amazing versatile lamp.'

content: 'bThis product is excellent, the build quality is superb. I've had the TaoTronics LED lights and I know how amazing that system is. The main point I like about this light is that it isn't just a bog standard light. The fact it has different systems for Reading, relaxing and studying is perfect, making it easy to adjust the light depending on your situation, not only do you have these quick settings but you can also adjust the brightness.bTaoTronics have thought about everything, they've even included a USB port so you can charge your phone or other devices, and the can be rotated/positioned into a different location without any hassle what so ever.Overall I think is product is excellent and I would defiantly recommend this to friends and family.'
title: 'This product is excellent, the build quality is super

content: 'bI enjoy that that head unit folds down when not in use, keeps it very discreet. Bright, providing great white light for proofing print images and reviewing documents. Cool running, and the USB plug is a bonus, perfect for keeping my phone on charge. I'd recommend this lamp to anyone.The base is solid enough to keep the unit steady when adjusting the light bar.'
title: 'Fantastic Desk / Reading Lamp'

content: 'bThis is an excellent LED desk lamp, for any price. I also own the similar AUKEY 12 watt LED desk lamp. I like the fact that the TaoTronics remembers the brightness setting for each model; with the AUKEY, the brightness doesn't change when changing modes. The light portion of the AUKEY rotates, making it easier to get a glare-free angle; the TaoTronics light does not rotate,
title: 'TaoTronics compared to AUKEY'

content: 'bI got this lamp on sale for my sister for Christmas and she loves it. This lamp deserves all the reviews that it has. She wanted a lamp she could use at night in bed that wouldn't blind her. The built-in USB was a bonus. The cord for her phone was always too short and now she doesn't have to curl to the side of her bed to use it.
title: 'Gave it as a gift... Now I want one too'

content: 'A good desk lamp at a reasonable price. The range of articulation is good, suitable for many uses.'bBut it is annoying that every time it is turned off, you have to actively press the Power button to turn it on. In other words, you can't put it on a timer or plug it into a socket controlled by a wall switch. Then, when you do press the Power button, you find that it re-starts automatically to the Reading setting, rather than your last-used setting. So you have to press at least twice more, to choose the warmth of light and then the intensity (one press for each level shift) you prefer.The buttons themselves are not very ergonomic - there is no sensation of a click as you press the rather tiny buttons.'
title: 'With a Little More Thought in the Design, Could Have Been Much Better'

content: 'bThese are very neat, sleek looking lamps. Work exactly the way described- the dimmers work perfectly and mood lighting couldn't be better. I ordered two lamps for my home office and just love them. Would definitely buy again. Btw delivery was really fast as well.
title: 'Great lamps'

content: 'bThis is a great lamp. What makes it even better is the price for the features that you get. With all the controls placed on a small but adequately sized capacitive touch panel, the lamp comes with four different modes, study, relax, and sleep, and each different mode has a different temperature to it. Study is a very cool white temperature - I find that it indeed does help with setting a study mood. Reading is a little warmer, and this is done by increasing the brightness on some more yellow LED's. I don't do much reading, however, my sister does lots of reading and she prefers to use this lamp over her own. Relax and sleep are of much more yellow/warmer temperatures. I am not the type to prefer such warm temperatures, however, I do find that it is much more easy on the eyes; everything that you do can be categorized into one of their four modes, and it makes whatever you are doing much more enjoyable, easy to do, and easy on the eyes.Not only that but with every mode, you are able to control the brightness of it. Every mode gives you five different brightness levels. Although I would\'ve preferred a smoother gradual increase/decrease of brightness, the five different levels gives more than enough options to really set the perfect brightness for yourself.'The timer feature is something that I do not find myself using as much. This is probably due to the fact that I do not do much reading. However, I can see that this is a great feature for those who read in bed - many people fall asleep with their lamp on, but with such a simple feature built in, the timer will automatically turn the lamp off in 60 minutes. A very simple, yet handy feature for those who would use something like this. Another very interesting feature of the lamp is the built-in USB port, this will allow you to charge your phone through the lamp. This, in combination with the timer feature, makes it an excellent bedside lamp.'bThe one complaint I have the build quality of the lamp, which is why I have to give this lamp four stars instead of five. The vertical stand/arm for the lamp seems to be flimsy at times, thus creating a little bit of space for the arm to wobble around, especially when you bend the arms to re-position the light direction and placement. Not only that, but the entire lamp seems to be made of slightly sub-par plastic. Asking for a metal build would be way too much, but asking for slightly better plastic won't hurt. The base of the lamp is heavy enough, however, to keep the entire lamp planted on your desk.bOverall, an excellent lamp, especially for the price. Full of features, will be perfect for virtually any scenario that you're in. However, the plastic build could be a little bit better.
title: 'Excellent Lamp, build quality could be a bit better.'

content: 'AVOID THIS SELLER/MANUFACTURER. My review at this time has been up for 5 months. In that time I received 0 votes in regards to helpful or unhelpful. In 1-2 days I received 6 unhelpful votes simply because my review was not 5 stars. If you read my review below (unedited) I actually like the lamp itself but had a few issues with the cord which dropped my review down a bit. They simply wanted to drop my (and others) voter ratings in hope we would delete our reviews. I went from a top 600 reviewer to a top 1100 reviewer because of this.'Vote manipulation such as that which happened to me is against Amazon T&C. I am editing the above into my review and moving down to 1 star to make others aware of the shameful practices that have been happening with the reviews on this product. If anybody else has had this happen to their review of this lamp I suggest you notify Amazon about it.'The lamp itself is nice and the arm unit can rotate in the base so you can point it in any direction. Some assembly is required by unscrewing a cap from the bottom of the arm and then putting it on the base then screwing the cap back on. No tools are required.'You can change the tone of the light from a very bright white to a softer yellow with the mode buttons and then you can adjust the brightness itself within each of those modes which is a nice option. When it is off the power button is illuminated red, and when you turn it on the current mode lights up red. Since it is a touch lamp instead of a switch this makes it very easy to turn on in the dark'And now the huge con of this lamp, the cord and plug. The cord plugs into the back of the lamp instead of being attached internally. The other end is a wall wort style plug which makes it a pain to find space for.'The biggest drawback is the length. It is about 3-3.5 feet long so unless you have a free plug right where you want the lamp you will be looking for an extension cord. I have never seen a lamp with a cord this short before so I reduced the rating to 3 stars.'
title: 'Avoid due to review vote manipulation practises'
